From there, he attends them [the customers] in a kind and cordial manner, knowing that with this treatment he will win his customers’ preference.  

He started with a loan from MFP which allowed him to make his first purchases.  Seeing the benefit that his business had, with the earnings that he had left, he returned to invest.  

He considers his business pretty worthwhile for the profit it leaves him and for the constant consumption of carbonated beverages because of the heat in the area.  

Before starting this business, he comments that he didn’t have problems, but he did have the desire to count on an additional income to support his partner with the household expenses.  

Therefore, now seeing the good results, he has plans to continue with his business and expand his merchandise to see his business grow.

This is his fourth loan with the MFP institution.  He is grateful for the opportunity to count on financial support.  This way he will feel more secure in advancing his business.  With the requested amount of 3000 soles, he will invest all of it in the purchase of carbonated drinks of diverse flavors, looking for lower prices for his bulk purchases.  In this way, he wishes to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: to buy diverse flavors of carbonated beverages.

loans.name: Hudson

texts.en: Hudson lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya with his wife and seven children. He has been farming for twenty seven years, and is currently growing palm trees and sweet bananas. His wife currently works as a businesswoman. He enjoys beekeeping for two main reasons: because honey is medicinal and because he loves to eat honey. This is his first loan, and he hopes to use the income from his hives to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya with his six children and his wife, who is both a farmer and a businesswoman. He likes that beekeeping is an inexpensive activity with many benefits. He plans to use the income from his hives to pay for his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward lives with his wife and three children in Kakamega, Kenya. He has been farming for five years, and is currently growing vegetables. He hopes to continue farming and wants to expand his farming activities in the future. He says he enjoys beekeeping because he loves honey, and he plans to use the income generated by his hives to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beehives to produce honey

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Mirian, de 41  años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, deseosa de progresar.  Es casada  con Einer  quien es docente, fruto de ésta unión tiene 2 hijos: Einer  de 15 años y Keiko de 13 años de edad respectivamente, habitando en su casa propia que compraron con esfuerzo y dedicación.
La actividad a la que de dedica Mirian es la costura y confección de  prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, logrando aprender todo lo necesario para desempeñarse en éste oficio y ha sabido hacerse conocida ganándose algunos clientes.
Para empezar instaló su propio taller en su casa, iniciándose con una sola maquina que compró con sus ahorros, atendiendo los requerimientos de sus clientes que han ido en aumento. Realiza ésta actividad desde hace más de 05 años, y hasta el momento de desempeña sola. 
Le gusta su actividad  por contar con un ingreso económico  para solventar los gastos del hogar y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, porque a su esposo no le alcanzaba con los ingresos que tiene en su  actividad de docente,  necesitando de un ingreso económico adicional.  Desea continuar y ampliar su negocio y comprar otras maquinas de coser.
Este es el  préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que cuenta con una poyo financiero para concretar sus planes, por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el  pago de sus cuotas para tener  un buen récord crediticio.
Con  el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  para costura como telas, hilos, elásticas, botones, etc., buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, para tener un mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Mirian is a hardworking, happy, dynamic woman who wants to get ahead.  She is married to Einer, who is a teacher, and they have two children, 15-year-old Einer and 13-year-old Keiker.  They live in the house they bought through hard work and dedication.

Mirian sews and makes women's, men's, and children's clothing for a living.  She learned this business when she was very young by studying at an occupational education center.  She was able to learn everything she needed to work in this field and she has been able to make a name for herself and attract some customers.

She started out by setting up her own sewing studio in her home with only one machine, which she bought with her savings, and tending to her customers' needs, which have been increasing.  She has been in this business for over five years and so far she has worked on her own.

She likes her business as she can count on the income to cover her household expenses and offer her family a better quality of life.  Her husband's salary from teaching was not enough and they needed additional income.  She wants to continue and expand her business and buy more sewing machines.

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she can count on financial support to solidify her plans and so she promises to be responsible about her payments so she will have a good credit record.

With the requested 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy sewing materials, such as fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, etc., and she will look for low prices for her bulk purchases so she will have a wider profit margin.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabric, thread, elastics, and buttons

loans.name: Kimkim Group

texts.en:
Kimkim is a group of five women members. All the members reside at Headquarter Veng in Churachandpur, located about 65 kilometres from Imphal, the capital of Manipur in the northeastern part of India. These tribal women have come together to a common platform to find a solution to overcome their hardships and build a way of sustainability.

Paozanem, the woman standing with her right hand half-raised in the picture, is the profile member. She is 36 years of age, and she has two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, and her sons assist their father. Her younger daughter is in her ninth standard, while the elder is married. She is determined to raise her daughter in the line of education, and she wants her to find a suitable job.

Paozanem used to prepare “gold finger” and a mixture of chili powder and salt in small packs, locally known as “acid”, and supply these products to shops in Churachandpur. 

Now Paozanem is engaged in parking duty around the District Hospital. However, there are inconveniences due to the absence of parking sheds. So she wants to build a public parking shed when she avails the next loan from WSDS.

The rest of the group members engaged themselves in selling vegetables in the markets and in supplying goods.

loans.use: to build a public parking shed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 46 años es una mujer soltera de 3 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos. Esta familia vive en una casa propia que hace mucho tiempo construyeron y se ubica en un distrito agrícola.
De mirada seria, pero de gran actitud, Juana trabaja con esmero.  Gracias a su esfuerzo logró criar y educar a sus hijos, y lo sigue haciendo. La agricultura es su actividad económica principal.  Hace 20 años que Juana se dedica al trabajo del campo, empezó sembrando papas, arvejas y maíz. En todos estos años aprendió del clima y las enfermedades que atacan sus cultivos, pero como ella es inteligente sabe cómo enfrentarlos. 
En la libertad del campo, también se encarga de criar animales como: carneros, caballos, vacas y cerdos, los que vende después de engordarlos. A pesar de tener varias responsabilidades, disponde de tiempo para atender sus cultivos, sus animales y su familia. 
Ahora está dispuesta a sembrar arvejas y un poco de papas, ya que se avecina la temporada de cosechas abundantes. Ella solicita una vez más de su ayuda para conseguir estas metas. Éste es su crédito número 12 con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas; por otro lado se siente contenta de pertenecer al banco comunal “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”.
Juana destinará los 2200 soles en la compra de 2 bolsa de semillas de arvejas y con lo restante comprará abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Juana is a 46 year-old single mother of 3 children, but only lives with 2. This family lives in their own home that they built a long time ago, located in an agricultural district. Serious yet of great attitude, Juana works with care. Thanks to her efforts she managed to raise and educate her children, and she continues doing it. Agriculture is her main economic activity. Juana has been working in the fields for 20 years. She began planting potatoes, peas and corn. In all these years she has learned about the climate and the diseases that attack the crops, but as she is intelligent she knows how to face it. In the fields she is also in charge of raising animals such as: sheep, horses, cows and pigs, those that are sold after fattening. In spite of having several responsibilities, she has time to take care of the crops, the animals and her family.Now it is time to plant peas and some potatoes, since the season of abundant harvests is approaching. 

She is requesting once again your help to obtain these goals. This is her 12th loan with MFP. She gives her word to be punctual with her monthly payments. She feels happy to belong to the communal bank “Lindo Amanecer de Cumutay”(Pretty Dawn of Cumutay).
Juana will set aside 2200 Peruvian Soles to purchase 2 sacks of pea seeds and with the rest she will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of pea seeds and with the rest she will buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 233 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de tener muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre, hermano, cuñado, sobrino. Instalados cómodamente en la casa de su madre.
La actividad que realiza Jorge es la venta de comidas rápidas como pollos broaster  y salchipàpas para lo cual cuenta con un carrito freidor de papas para freír sus pollos broaster y papas, el cual instala en el frontis de la casa de su madre todas la noches, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. 
Iniciándose hace más de 02 años, contando con el apoyo de su madre en la preparación y atención al público.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico y una ocupación ya que le falta terminar sus estudios de técnico  en computación, y con las ganancias está pagando sus estudios, además de poder apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, viendo las ganancias que le deja está ahorrando para en un futuro constituir su propia empresa de reparación de computadoras y sentirse un profesional realizado.
Este es el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido con el apoyo financiero para poder concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues  conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para implementar su negocio como platos, tenedores, mesas, sillas y otros. Así también ingredientes como papas, pollos y verduras que piensa comprar a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Jorge, 23 years old, is a hard worker and entrepreneur who is eager to get ahead,  He is single and lives with his mother, brother, brother-in-law and nephew. They are all settled comfortably in his mother's house.
Jorge works selling fast-food like chicken, hotdogs and fries, rotisserie chicken and other fried foods.  He has a fryer station installed in front of his mother’s house every night where he kindly attends to his clients.
He started over two years ago with his mother’s support in food preparation and customer service. 
He considers his business profitable by the good wages he makes. He likes his business as it allows him to earn a livable wage and provides a job while 
is finishing his studies to be a computer technician.  His profits pay for his studies, in addition to supporting his parents’ household expenses.  Seeing his earnings, he is saving for the future to build his own computer repair business and become a professional.  
This is his third loan with the MFP institution.  He is grateful for the financial support to realize his plans.  In addition, he feels comfortable with his community bank as he knows the other members and considers them to be responsible.
With the loan amount requested of 2500 new soles, he will invest in the purchase of utensils for his business such as plates, forks, tables, chairs and the like. Additionally, he will buy ingredients such as potatoes, chicken and vegetables that he plans to buy at wholesale prices.

loans.use: purchase of utensils for his business such as plates, forks, tables, chairs and the like.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi, de 67 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, está separada hace muchos años atrás. Sus hijos ya son independientes. Vive en compañía de una jovencita la cual contrato para su compañía, habitando su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Noemi es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para eso cuenta con una bodega la cual está instalada en su casa, desde  donde atiende cada día a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos, a quienes atiende  de manera amable y cordial, a lo largo de los 05 años que viene trabajando con su bodega, realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de una jovencita la cual contrato para que la acompañe y en ocasiones con el apoyo de sus hijos cuando la visitan.
Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para poder cubrir los gastos básicos de su casa. Por lo contrario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continúa trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer.
Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con banco comunal pues le agrada el trabajo que viene realizando apoyando a las personas a avanzar con sus proyectos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra de más abarrotes buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al contado, para así surtir su bodega y contar con preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year-old Noemi is a hardworking and enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead.  She has been separated for many years now.  Her children are independent.  She lives in her own home with a young lady she hired for her company. 

Noemi's business is selling essential grocery items from a small store she set up in her home.  This is where serves her customers, who are mainly her own neighbors, with kindness and courtesy.  For the five years she has had her store, she has worked with the help of a young lady she hired and occasionally with the help of her children when they visit.

She likes her work because it allows her to be in the comfort of her own home.  She also likes the income it generates to cover her basic household expenses.  On the other hand, she does not like it when some of her customers fall behind on their credit payments, but this does not discourage her and she keeps working with the same enthusiasm.  She currently plans to continue with her business and to make it grow.

This will be her second loan with MFP.  She hopes for their support so she can solidify her plans.  In addition to feeling comfortable with her communal bank, she likes the work it does to help people move ahead with their projects. 

With the requested 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy more groceries and look for better prices for her cash purchases so she can stock her store and remain her customers' favorite.

loans.use: to buy essential items to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for bee colonies.

loans.name: Juvencio

texts.es:
Juvencio, de 60 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar, es separado de la madre de sus hijos, vive en compañía de sus hijos de 22, y 20 años de edad, habitando en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Juvencio  es el cultivo de yucas y plátanos  para la venta en los mercados de la localidad y para su consumo personal. Parelo, siembra palma aceitera en un terreno de 20 hectáreas  que lo adquirió hace mas de 30 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio y en el sus hijos lo ayudan. Le gusta su negocio, pues lo conoce muy bien, y esta experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos, además de las ganancias que le deja con la cual a sabido mantener a su familia y procura que no les falte lo necesario. Por lo contrario lo que no le gusta es que la lejanía de su ubicación, pues carece de servicios básicos como la luz eléctrica, pero con los nuevos programas eso se está logrando mejorar, ahora tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejar a sus hijos con algo seguro para sus futuro. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abono para la producción de palma así como el pago de personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Juvencio is a hardworking and enterprising man who really wants to get ahead.  He is separated from the mother of his children and he lives with his 22- and 20-year-old children in his own home.  

Juvencio grows yucca and bananas to sell in local markets and for personal consumption.  He also grows palm for oil on a 20ha plot that he acquired over 30 years ago, which is how long he has been doing this work, now with the help of his children.  He likes his business as he knows it well and he is passing on his experience to his children.  He also likes the income from it, which provides him with the means to support his family and make sure they do not want for anything.  On the other hand, what he does not like is the remoteness of his location, as he does not have basic utilities such as electricity.  However, things are improving with the new programs and he currently wants to expand his business and leave his children with something secure for their future.  This will be his second loan with MFP and he hopes for their support in continuing with his objectives.  With the requested 1,000 nuevos soles, he will buy fertilizer to grow palms and he will pay for labor to harvest his produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow palms and to pay for labor to harvest his produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for bee colonies.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Paterna works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store and fishing. Paterna is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Paterna successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fish vending, fishing and general store business.

Paterna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 48 years old and married with two children.

Eliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles, etc..

Eliza has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Eliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stock of items to sell like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 6 years. Lilibeth earns more income from food vending.

Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stock of items to sell like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and married with three children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Norma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norma requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Norma has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
This is Necitas, 37, a resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Larry and mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating a mineral water distribution business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Necitas buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sells the water in 5-gallon containers at a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Necitas hopes that her children will finish their studies and also hopes of having her own water station. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Rosalia has been in this business for 40 years. Rosalia also earns income from buying and selling livestock.

Rosalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a denture business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her denture business.

Erlinda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her denture business.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.en:
Arlinda is a 41-year-old farmer from Jagna, Bohol, Philippines. She is married and has four children. Arlinda has been engaged in a banana plantation business for several years now. Arlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her banana plantation, thus improving her harvest and yield.
In the future, Arlinda hopes of making her business a success and saving money for reinvestment and for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Herlenbaatar

texts.en:
Herlenbaatar is 33 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife works at a local school as an assistant teacher. His daughter, Amarmend, age 2, goes to local kindergarten.

Herlenbaatar has been providing a transportation service business in town. His car has been broken for a while and he has been unable to provide his business in the time since. His car needs some improvements and repairs in order for his business to run smoothly. He is now requesting 4,000,000 MNT to purchase wheels and spare parts to restart his business again. Herlenbaatar is a hardworking, responsible and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase wheels and spare parts to restart his business again.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya, where she grows maize and bananas. She is married with three children, and her husband is currently working as a watchman. 

Roda likes Honey Care beehives because they produce lots of honey and are easy to manage. This is her first loan, and she plans to use the extra income generated by her hives to educate her children to a higher level. Her hope is to one day live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Janina

texts.es:
Janina, de 25 años, es una mujer joven muy amable, es madre de Meylin de 2 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su conviviente Carlos de 28, ella desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia es por eso que a diario se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo. El trabajo de Janina consiste en la venta de ropa, zapatos y bebidas gasificadas, durante mucho tiempo ella sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida, esto debido a que no tenía un ingreso propio de dinero para su casa, es por eso que desde hace un año decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir. Pensó que sus amigos, vecinos o familiares desearían comprar zapatos y ropa dependiendo de la temporada que estén, es así que inicio su negocio que ahora le da muy buenos resultados. También cuando esta en su casa se dedica a la venta de distintas bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores.
Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar a lado de su menor hija, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tienen dos ingresos para su hogar, desea seguir creciendo, por eso tiene en mente ampliar sus ventas y poder ofrecer mayor variedad y calidad de prendas a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 04 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a pagar de manera puntual con sus cuotas y demostrar como en anteriores oportunidades que es una socia muy buena y así retribuir el apoyo que le brindan en su banco comunal en donde todos son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas mercaderías zapatos, ropa y bebidas gasificadas de distintos sabores y marcas.
texts.en:
Janina, age 25, is a very nice young woman.  She has a two year old child, Meylin, and she lives in her own house with her life partner, 28 year old Carlos.  She wishes to give her family a better quality of life.  That is why she puts so much effort into her work every day.  Janina sells clothes, shoes, and carbonated drinks.  For a long time she suffered through some setbacks in her life.  This is because she did not have her own income for her house.  That is why, a year ago, she decided to start a new project with the hope of being successful.

She thought that her friends, neighbors, or relatives would like to buy shoes and clothes according to the season.  That is how she started her business that now gives her very good results.  Also, when she is at home she sells different flavors of soft drinks.  She likes what she does because it allows her to have time to be with her little daughter.  Also, ever since she started with her business, it has been going well for her financially because they now have two incomes for their household.

She wishes to continue growing.  She is thinking of expanding her sales and being able to offer a greater variety and quality of clothes to her customers.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes to receive your help in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments punctually.  She pledges to demonstrate, as in previous times, that she is a very good member.  This way she will repay the support given by her communal bank, where all are very responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy more shoes, clothes, and different flavors and brands of soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, clothes, and different flavors and brands of soft drinks.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 60 years old and married with eight children.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Fely has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats used for house repair and construction) for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and buying and selling firewood.

Fely aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Merlene

texts.en:
Merlene is 54 years old, married and has two children. 

Merlene is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlene has been raising pigs for 6 years and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian lives in Kakamega County in western Kenya with her husband and four children. This is her first loan, and she plans to use the money she gains from beekeeping to purchase even more beehives. 

She hopes that her children will one day complete their schooling so that they will be able to provide for themselves.

loans.use: to buy beehives to supplement her income.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 56 years old and married with seven children. Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dried seaweed in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seaweed to sell. Anita has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 35 years and also earns an income from fishing. Anita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seaweed to sell through her business.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela siempre con su trabajo como conserje en una empresa, siendo una madre soltera de 3 hijos ha sabido salir adelante con ellos quienes ahora son mayores de edad todos con diferentes labores y le apoyan a ella, sus créditos los utiliza para construcción de su casa, poco a poco ha venido haciéndole mejoras gracias al apoyo de financiamiento por lo cual está muy agradecida y con este nuevo préstamo hará divisiones de cuartos, comprara hierro, cemento, arena bloques, esto para asegurar su casa y tener privacidad con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Angela, while always working as a janitor at a company and also being a single mother of 3 children, has known out how to get ahead with them. They are adults now and all help her out, each doing different jobs.  

She uses her loans for construction on her house.  Little by little she has been making improvements to it, thanks to the financing, for which she is very grateful.  With this new loan, she will make divisions between rooms, buy iron, cement, and sand blocks to secure her house and have privacy with her family.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, and sand blocks for construction.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.

loans.name: Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache” conformado por 05 socios, entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa-Prosperidad. Jovita de 42 años es  casada y tiene  03 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la crianza de vacas y cuyes y también a la   venta de leche y queso. Este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. A futuro le gustaría instalar un puesto en un lugar comercial donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Con el crédito que solicito comprará alimentos para sus animales. El Nuevo grupo “Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache” agradece el crédito brindado, ya que hace posible su progreso. Jovita es la primera de del lado izquierdo viste chompa roja a rayas y pantalón verde. En la parte superior lado izquierdo  esta la señora Luisa, la cual no pudo asistir por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache," which is made up of 5 partners.  They are enthusiastic to start working with the Programa-Prosperidad [Prosperity Program].  

Jovita is 42 years old, married and has 3 dependent children.  She raises cows and guinea pigs for a living and also sells milk and cheese.  This business has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses.  In the future, she hopes to set up a stand in a commercial area where she can offer her goods. With the loan she solicited, she will buy feed for her animals. 

The new group "Señor De La Esperanza De Huaripache" is thankful for the loan offered, as it allows for the group's progress.  Jovita is the first person on the left side in the photo, in the red, striped sweater and green pants.  In the top left part of the photo is Luisa, who couldn't be present for the photo due to work.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 55 years old and married with ten children.

Arsenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery products to sell.

Arsenia has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fishing.

Arsenia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 50 years old, married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cecelia has a native mat making business in the Philippines. Cecelia requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native mat making.

Cecelia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Cecelia would like to save enough to support financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native mat making.

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.en:
Cayetana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing Php 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her fishing business. Cayetana has been in this business for 6 years. She also earns income from food vending.  

Cayetana successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her fishing and food vending business. Cayetana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing equipment for her business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Cristita works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines. Cristita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her native mat making.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native mat making

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Mr.Byambasuren is a 63 year old widow who lives in a ger (a yurt) in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She has been running a service business of delivering food to local market workers/businesses for lunch and breakfast since 2008. She has already built regular customers of her own in the local market and she cooks to order. She has a good record of repayment on her previous loans in XacBank. She is now requesting 260,000MNT to purchase necessary inventory for her food delivery business. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase necessary inventory for her food delivery business

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 39 years old and married with six children.

Shirly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc..

Shirly has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from coconut wine vending and livestock raising.

Shirly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Diambogne's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été formé en Décembre 2008 il est composé de femmes et regroupe des femmes d'un même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales .
Le responsable madame Fatou est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 garçons et 2 filles.
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo habillé tout blanc avec un foulard blanc sur la tète.
Fatou fait de l'embauche bovine depuis bientôt 6 ans elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine . Son nouveau crédit de 75000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer deux moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard.
les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This women's group was created on December 2008.  Its members all come from the same village and are united by good social relationships.  

Fatou is the representative of the group.  She is 51 years old and the mother of six children (four boys and two girls).  She is standing at the far right in the photo, dressed in white and wearing a scarf on her head.

Fatou has been fattening cattle for almost six years, and she has a good experience in this field.  She will use her new loan of 75,000 CFA francs to buy two sheep which she will raise for future resale.

With the profits from her business, Fatou will be able to take care of her children's nutritional and school needs.  She will also be able to strengthen her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008 il est composé de femmes issues d'un même village et unies par de liens sociaux communes et entretiennent d'éxèlentes relations professionnelles.
Le responsable madame Mayé est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 garçons et 2 filles .
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée. Mayé s'active dans l'embauche depuis bientôt cinq ans elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer deux moutons pour faire de l'embauche et de pouvoir les revendre.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants. Mais ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 1, 2008, is made up of women who come from the same village.  They are united by common social ties and enjoy excellent professional relationships.

The group's representative, Mayé, is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of six children (four boys and two girls).  She is standing at the far right in the photo, raising her hand. She has been fattening livestock for almost five years and has a good experience in this field.

She will use her new loan of 50,000 CFA francs to buy two sheep to fatten and resell.

With the profits from her business, she will be able to take care of her children's nutritional, educational and health needs.  Her profits will also allow her to strengthen her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Kati

texts.es:
Kati, de 44 años es una mujer activa y creativa, además ser perseverante y luchadora, es conviviente con el padre de sus su hija de 13 años, desea poder brindar lo mejor a su menor hija, educación y calidad de vida. Viven juntos en una casa propia que logro comprar en base a esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio.
Kati  tiene como trabajo el de la venta de abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad; este trabajo lo realiza en su casa. Se levanta temprano al mercado a realizar la compra de los productos de diario como pollo; verduras y algunos tubérculos; cuando vuelve saca los productos a la vereda de su casa y empieza con la venta; lleva más de 05 años en esta actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su, al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia nada de conocimiento para este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para poder tener contentos a su clientes.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar su tiempo para hacer otras actividades, además cuando tiene un tiempo libre se va al mercado a vender algunos productos, sobre todo sabanas y cochas, le esta yendo bien en su negocio, tiene muchos clientes y esto le genera buenas ganancias, espera poder seguir trabajando y hacer crecer a su negocio para poder seguir mejorando su economía. Por tanto éste será el crédito número 01 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además esta convencida que será una buena socia. Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 900 soles, comprará mas productos y abarrotes como pollo, verduras y algunos tubérculos para su tienda, además de comprar bebidas gasificadas ya que quiere implementarse para poder vender en esta temporada de fuerte sol.
texts.en:
Kati, 44, is an active and creative woman as well as determined and a fighter. She is in a common law relationship with the father of her 13 year old daughter. She wants to be able to offer the best for her young daughter; education and quality of life. They live together in their own house that they bought with effort and much sacrifice.

Kati sells groceries and other products of basic necessities; she does this work from her house. She wakes up early to go to the market to purchase daily products such as chicken, vegetables and some tubers. When she returns she takes the products to the sidewalk of her house and begins selling them. She has been doing this for more than 5 years which she does with some help. In the beginning, it was a little complicated as she didn't know anything about the business, but with time she learned and now has the necessary guidelines to be able to keep her customers happy.

What she likes about her work is that she can use her time for other activities. When she has free time she goes to the market to sell some products, mainly, sheets and comforters. Her business is doing well, she has many customers and this generates good profits. She hopes to continue working and to grow her business in order to continue improving her finance. 

This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support to be able to continue increasing her working capital. As well, she is convinced that she will be a good member. She likes belonging to the communal bank in which she works, since everyone is responsible and very supportive with one another.

She is requesting 900 Peruvian Soles which she will buy more products and groceries such as chicken, vegetables and some tubers for her store, in addition to fizzy drinks as she wants to be able to sell it in this season of extreme heat.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables, and some tubers for her store as well as fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Debner

texts.es:
Debner, de 53 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, esta casadi con Daysi, quien es ama de casa y juntos tienen 3 hijos. además convive con sus padres, hermana y su abuela.
La actividad que realiza Debner es el transporte en mototaxi, vehículo que compró con su propio capital. Hace 03 años que viene realizando este oficio, recorriendo las calles buscando clientes a los que brinda su servicio de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta su actividad pues le brinda los ingresos económicos positivos y le permite tener un oficio ya que no conseguía empleo, además de poder manejar su propio tiempo y sentirse independiente. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda de transporte en la ciudad y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y crecer, deseando comprarse otra unidad de transporte e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le agrada el apoyo que brindan a las personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, también en el pago del servicio a un mecánico.
texts.en:
Debner, 53, is hard-working and diligent man. He is married to Daysi, who is a housewife, and they have three children together. He also lives with his parents, sister and grandmother. 

Debner makes a living doing mototaxi transportation. He bought his vehicle with his own capital. He has been doing this work for three years, traveling the streets looking for customers to offer his service to in a friendly and cordial manner. He likes his work because it offers him positive income and allows him to have a job since he had been unable to find employment. It also allows him to be able to manage his own time and feel independent.

He considers his business quite profitable due to the demand for transportation in the city and the good earnings that it allows him. Because of this, he has plans to expand his business and grow, hoping to buy another transportation unit and increase his income. 

This will be his third loan with the MFP institution, which is why he is hoping for their collaboration to allow him to continue with his goals. He also feels good with his communal bank since he likes the support they offer to people. With the amount requested of 1500 nuevos soles, he will invest in the purchase of parts for the maintenance of his mototaxi as well as pay for the services of a mechanic.

loans.use: to buy parts for the maintenance of his mototaxi, and to pay for the services of a mechanic

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo’s main source of income comes from farming. He plants and harvests corn in their village. 

Marcelo is married and blessed with three children. He and his wife desire to give a better way of living to their children. He is currently sending his children to school to pursue their education.

With his determination to respond immediately to his children's needs in school, Marcelo also engages in the livestock business. His income from the business mostly went for his children’s fees for school. 

Marcelo wishes for a loan of PHP 30,000 in order to continue operating the business. He plans to use the loan to buy sacks of feed and vaccines for quick growth of his hogs.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and vaccines for quick growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée au cycle premier du banc villageois regroupe des femmes d'un même quartier unies par de bons liens sociaux et professionnels. Son responsable madame mariéme est une femme marié âgée de 34 et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est debout à gauche de la photo la main levée . Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis bientôt 10 ans. Avec son nouveau crédit de 300000 franc cfa elle va se payer des balles de tissus et des paires de chaussures qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier par crédit ou au comptant.
Les bénéfices réalisés par cette activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses deux enfants mais également des renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the Banc Villageois.  It is made up of two women who come from the same neighborhood and are united by good social and professional ties.

The group's representative, Mareme, is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  In the photo, she is the woman in the left, raising her hand.  She has been actively involved in the sale of fabrics for almost ten years.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs, she will buy shoes and bales of clothes, which she will resell for retail in her neighborhood, for cash or on credit.

Profits from Mareme's business allow her to take care of her two children's nutritional, educational and health needs.  They also enable her to strengthen her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Elenita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

Elenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa has three children currently taking their education. She shares that she doesn’t have any treasure to leave for her children. The only treasure she can leave is education; that’s why she wants them to finish their college level of education and become professionals someday. She is striving just to meet her children’s needs.  

Elsa owns a sari-sari store business in their village. She has managed the business for five years. She sells a variety of goods like junk foods, bread, spices and drinks. Elsa is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy drinks and canned goods to sell. 

Elsa dreams that someday her small sari-sari store will become a mini-grocery to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy drinks and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Oumy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 16/07/2008 il est composé de femmes d'un même quartier unies par de bons  liens sociaux.
Son responsable Madame Fatoumata est une femme mariée agée de 50 ans et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 garçons et 5 filles. Elle assise à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée habillée d'une robe vert fleurette.Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis longtemps . Son nouveau crédit de 100000 francs lui permettra de se procurer des tissus divers pour les revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins financiers alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, created on July 16, 2008, is made up of women who come from the same neighborhood and are united by good social ties.

The group's representative, Fatoumata, is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of ten children (five boys and five girls).  In the photo, she is sitting at the far left, wearing a green flowery dress and raising her hand.  She has been actively involved in commerce for a long time, selling fabrics.

With her new loan of 100,000 francs, she will be able to buy various fabrics, which she will resell for retail in her neighborhood.

Profits from Fatoumata's business allow her to take care of her children's financial, nutritional and educational needs.  They also enable her to strengthen her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for retail resale.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

Aurelia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

In the future, Aurelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Yuly Marcela

texts.es:
Yuly es una joven de 23 años de edad, que le apuesta a la realización de sus sueños. El más importante es poder terminar sus estudios universitarios y dedicarse de tiempo completo al negocio familiar. 
Sus padres son propietarios de una panadería, la cual ella administra. Con el propósito de sacar adelante el negocio. Hoy tiene como meta convertir su microempresa en un lugar representativo, por lo cual planea ampliar la oferta de productos y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de artículos de la canasta familiar. Espera que esta inversión le genere mejores ingresos y le permita generar una fuente de empleo.
Su mayor deseo es poder garantizarle a sus padres mejores condiciones de vida ya que por sus edades requieren cuidados especiales.
texts.en:
Yuly is a young woman of 23 who is committed to realizing her dreams. The most important thing for her is to be able to finish her university studies and work full time in the family business.

Her parents are the owners of a bakery, which she manages with the goal of advancing the business. Now she has the goal of converting their microbusiness into a neighborhood establishment. For this reason, she plans to expand the products offered, and to do that she is applying for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of basic household items. She hopes that this investment will generate better income for her and allow her to generate a source of employment. Her greatest desire is to be able to guarantee her parents better living conditions, since they require special care due to their age.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for her store

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, de 51 años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora. Es divorciada, tiene un hijo de 14 años y es ella quien se encarga de los gastos. Vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo por quien desea trabajar para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Erika, de dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, perfumería, actividad que lleva realizando por 05 años,  permitiéndole ayudar a las demás mujeres con su apariencia. En su casa posee una pequeña vitrina en donde exhibe sus productos y espera a que sus clientes vayan a compartir un momento agradable escogiendo los productos que mas le convenga. Cuando tiene muchos productos en stock se va a las casa de sus clientes y ofrece siempre con una sonrisa y ofreciendo a crédito el producto. Por otro lado, cuenta con otro negocio que es la construcción de vitrinas de alumnio. 
Trabaja sola ya que se siente cómoda, esto le permite tener mas ingresos, además de poder tener tiempo para poder estar a lado de su menor hijo quien a su edad necesitan mucho de sus cuidados. Espera poder seguir haciendo feliz y brindando esa seguridad de sentirse bella a las personas, y en el futuro le gustaría tener un local en donde pueda ofrecer otro tipo de productos. Este será el crédito número 02 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece ya que todos son muy responsables y muy buenos.
Con el monto solicitado 4,000 soles, comprará mas productos de belleza,y perfumes para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erika, who is 51, is a friendly and entrepreneurial woman. She is divorced and has a son who is 14, and she is responsible for the expenses. She lives in her own house along with her son, for whom she wants to work to be able to offer him a better quality of life.

Erika sells beauty products and perfumes, a business that she has been in for five years, allowing her to help other women with their appearance. In her house she has a little display case where she exhibits her products and waits for her customers to come to spend some pleasant time choosing the products that most suit them. When she has a lot of products in stock, she goes out to the houses of her customers and offers her products on credit, and always with a smile. 

In addition, she has another business, which is the construction of aluminum display cases. She works alone, since it feel comfortable. This allows her to have more income, in addition to being able to have time to be at the side of her young son, who at his age requires a lot of her attention. She hopes to be able to continue making people happy and offering them the security of feeling beautiful, and in the future she would like to have a shop where she could offer other types of products. 

This will be her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have a loan so that she can fulfill her goals. On her part, she promises to be punctual with her payments and thus stay on good terms with the group she belongs to, since everyone is very responsible and very good. With the amount she has applied for, 4000 PEN, she will buy more beauty products and perfumes to be able to offer her customers a greater quantity and variety.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and perfumes to be able to offer a greater quantity and variety to her customers.

loans.name: Safietou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 29/12/2010 il regroupe des femmes issues d'une même localité unies par de bons liens sociaux .
La responsable madame Safiétou est une femme mariée âgée de 32 et mère de 2 enfants  dont 1 garçon et  une fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et dispose d'une expérience dans ce domaine .Elle debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en uniforme bleu blanc.
Avec son nouveau crédit de 60000 francs cfa elle va acheter des tubes de lait de toilettes et des bouteilles de parfums qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier à des proches et amies intimes.
es bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de ses enfants telles que l'achat de fournitures scolaires .
texts.en:
This group was formed on 29 December 2010 and comprises women from the same area who are united by good social relations.
The leader, Ms. Safiétou, is a married woman aged 32 with two children - one son and one daughter. She has been active in the commercial sector for a long time and has experience in this field. She is standing all the way on the right in the photo, dressed in blue and white with her hand raised.
With her new loan of 60,000 FCFA, she is going to buy tubes of lotion and bottles of perfume that she will sell at retail in her area to her close friends and relatives.
The profits realized from this business allow her to provide for herself and her children, including paying for their school expenses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, consisting of lotion and perfume.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old and married.

Maricel has a banana retail business in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for 11 years.  In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a hog raiser in the village of Namnama Alfonso Lista. He is currently fattening four hogs. Aside from this, he also grows corn on eight hectares of farmland.

Regie would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000, which will allow him to buy hog feed, and some of the amount will be used for the maintenance of his eight hectares of farmland. He also believes that through this loan, he can ensure the proper growth of his hog-raising business. Regie hopes and prays that he can further keep his farming and hog raising more productive and profitable so that he can save money, which will be used to pay for the education of his two children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and maintain his eight hectares of corn farmland

loans.name: Khadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 29/12/2010 il regroupe des femmes d'une même localité unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Madame Coumba est la responsable elle debout à l’extrême droite de la photo habillée en uniforme bleu ciel.
Elle est une femme mariée âgée de 67 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles .Coumba fait du commerce de crème glace depuis bientôt 10 ans elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine .Avec son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs cfa elle v a se procurer du lait en poudre du pain de singe et du sucre pour faire de la crème et le revendre au détail au niveau du quartier. les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on 29 December 2010 and comprises women from the same area who are united by good professional and social relationships.
Ms. Coumba, the group leader, is standing all the way on the right, dressed in sky blue.
She is 67 years old, married, and has five children - two sons and three daughters. Coumba has run an ice cream business for close to ten years and has good experience in this field. With her new loan of 50,000 FCFA, she is going to buy powdered milk, monkey bread, and sugar to make ice cream and sell it at retail in her area. The profits from her business allow her to take care of her children's food, school, and health needs.

loans.use: To buy powdered milk and sugar to make ice cream.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre  femmes du groupe  BENKADI ont  en moyenne 30 ans et  5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de YASSO / SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font la restauration, la vente de boissons et  des divers articles. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3er prêt solidaire.
Madame LOUISE  (1 ère personne debout  de la gauche  vers la droite en camisole bleu) est très connue dans son activité  de vente de boissons de tous dans le village. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une trentaine de casiers de boissons pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de croitre. Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes à Koutiala et au Burkina Faso. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à domicile, à  la foire (les Vendredi) et dans les grandes foires environnantes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame LOUISE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in traditional extended households, the four women of the "Benkadi" group are on average 30 years old with five children. They all live in the town of Yasso/San in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood, marriage, and family links. They run businesses selling meals, drinks and various items.
With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity (group) loan.
Ms. Louise (standing first from the left and dressed in blue) is very well known in her business selling drinks to everyone in town. She intends to use her loan to buy thirty cases of drinks in order to better satisfy her clientele, which never stops growing. 
She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Koutiala and in Burkina Faso. She makes her sales in cash, at retail, and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. Her sales take place at home, at the weekly market days (on Fridays), and at the larger market days in the area.
With this loan, Ms. Louise hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq  femmes du groupe  DJIGUISSEME  ont  en moyenne 42 ans et  7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Yasso cercle SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font la vente de divers articles. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3eme prêt solidaire.
Madame, BIOWE  (1ere  personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite avec foulard bleu) excelle  dans la vente de condiments et de céréales sèches. Elle  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  1 carton de Sounbala, 3 cartons de Maggi et 200 kg de mil. Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes du village. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à la foire de Yasso  tous les Vendredi et dans les grandes foires environnantes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame BIOWE  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in traditional extended households, the five women of the "Djiguisseme" group are on average 42 years old with seven children. They all live in the town of Yasso, San circle, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood, marriage, and family links. They run businesses selling various items.
With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity (group) loan.
Ms. Biowe (standing first from the left and dressed in blue) runs a successful business selling condiments and dried cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy one carton of soumbala, three cartons of Maggi, and 200 kg of millet. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in the town. She makes her sales in cash, at retail, and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. Her sales take place at the weekly market days (on Fridays) in Yasso and at the larger market days in the area.
With this loan, Ms. Biowe hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 19,500 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy various items

loans.name: Sewesse Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe  SEWESSE ont  en moyenne 30 ans et  6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de YASSO cercle de SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente  de condiments et divers articles. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  3eme prêt solidaire.
Madame, REBEKA   (2eme personne debout de la gauche vers la droite,  en enceinte) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 douzaines d’habits pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne  auprès des grossistes du Burkina Faso. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, à la foire de San et  dans les grandes foires environnantes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame REBEKA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de18.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in traditional extended households, the four women of the "Sewesse" group are on average 30 years old with six children. They all live in the town of Yasso, San circle, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood, marriage, and family links. They run businesses buying and selling condiments and various items.
With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity (group) loan.
Ms. Rebeka (pregnant, and standing second from the left) intends to use her loan to buy five dozen sets of children's clothing. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Burkina Faso. She makes her sales in cash, at retail, and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women. Her sales take place at the weekly market days in San and at the larger market days in the area.
With this loan, Ms. Rebeka hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Ambenakan Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  AMBENAKAN ont en moyenne  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA, cercle de SAN région de SEGOU (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de calebasses. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les   prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe AMBENAKAN sont à leur 11eme  prêt solidaire
AWA (1ere personne debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  50 colis de calebasses. AWA s’approvisionne à BLA auprès des grossistes pour venir revendre à Kimparana et dans les foires hebdomadaires des villages au  comptant, en détail  en espèce et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 41500FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt, dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Ambenakan" group are on average 40 years old with five children and all live in traditional extended households in Kimparana, in the San circle, in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
These women know each other through neighbourhood and family links, and run businesses selling various items such as calabashes (bottle gourds).
After having properly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Ambenakan group are on their 11th solidarity (group) loan.
Awa (standing first from the right in the photo) intends to use her loan to buy 50 packages of calabashes. Awa gets her supplies from the wholesalers at Bla and sells her goods at Kimparana and at the weekly market days in the area. She makes her sales at retail, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed mainly of women.
With this loan, she hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 41,500 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan, pay for health, food, and school expenses, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy calabashes.

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les femmes du groupe DJEKADI ont  en moyenne 35  ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes la ville de KIMPARANA dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales   et  de diverses marchandises. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 11eme  prêt solidaire.
Madame, SANATA (1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite en complet bazin orange sur la photo) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  4 colis de calebasses (en raison de 70 calebasses par colis). Elle  s’approvisionne à la grande foire de Bla. Elle effectue ses ventes   au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de   femmes à la foire de YANGASSO et les jours ordinaires à domicile.
Avec ce prêt, Madame SANATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All married and living in traditional extended households, the women of the "Djekadi" group are on average 35 years old with six children. They all live in the town of Kimparana in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood and family links. They run businesses buying and selling cereals and various items.
With the goal of expanding their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 11th solidarity (group) loan.
Ms. Sanata (standing first from the left and dressed in an orange damask outfit) intends to use her loan to buy four cases of calabashes (with 70 calabashes per case). She gets her supplies at the grand market fair in Bla. She makes her sales at retail in cash to a clientele composed mainly of women at the market day fair in Yangasso and at home on regular days.
With this loan, Ms. Sanata hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy and sell calabashes.

loans.name: Fillasso Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FILLASSO  ont en moyenne  30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA  un village du cercle de San.
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires,    de lait.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les neuf prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FILLASSO sont  à leur dixième prêt solidaire.
KOUMBA grande vendeuse de lait (1ere personne de la droite vers la gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  150 litres de lait par jour en vu de ravitailler le centre de collecte de lait ‘’Danaya Nono’’. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des bergers du village. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 27500 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the "Fillasso" group are on average 30 years old with four children and all live in traditional extended households in Kimparana, in the circle of San.
These women know each other through family connections, and run businesses selling various items such as condiments and milk.
After having properly repaid their nine previous loans, the women of the Ambenakan group are on their tenth solidarity (group) loan.
Koumba (standing first from the right in the photo) is a major milk seller and intends to use her loan to buy 150 litres of milk per day in order to resupply the milk collection centre "Danaya Nono." She gets her supplies from the dairy farmers in the town. 
She hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA, which will be used to pay for health, food, and school expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh milk.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les cinq femmes du groupe SEWA ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de KIMPARANA / SAN  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments et de céréales.
