Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus croissantes  et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  12eme prêt solidaire.
Madame SITAN  (présidente de l’association debout vers la gauche  en complet wax et en sourire) excelle dans la vente de condiments de tous genres, de tissus wax et de bazin riche. Elle est très sollicitée dans le  village de Kimparana et ses environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 bidons de vingt litres d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de Maggi, 1 carton de poivre, 3 cartons de concentrée de tomate, 15 pièces de wax et 5 pièces de bazin riche. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala mensuellement. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes au grand marché de Kimparana. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame SITAN espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Mostly married and living in traditional extended households, the five women of the "Sewa" group are on average 41 years old with seven children. They all live in the town of Kimparana/San in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbourhood connections. They run businesses buying and selling condiments and cereals.
With the goal of meeting the growing and pressing needs of their expanding clientele, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program and are on their 12th solidarity (group) loan.
Ms. Sitan (president of the group, standing on the left dressed in a "wax" style outfit with a smile) runs a successful business selling all kinds of condiments, "wax" style fabric, and damask. She is highly sought-after in the town of Kimparana and the surrounding areas. 
She intends to use her loan to buy two 20-litre cans of cooking oil, two cartons of Maggi, one carton of pepper, three cartons of tomato concentrate, 15 sets of "wax" style fabric, and five sets of damask. She gets her supplies every month at Koutiala. She makes her sales at retail in cash to a mixed clientele at the grand market in Kimparana.
With this loan, Ms. Sitan hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and help her spouse take care of the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy various items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 53 years old and married with five children. 

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Evangeline has been raising livestock for 13 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to create financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Moukouri

texts.fr: Moukouri est un homme de 39 ans, célibataire et père de 3 garçons, tous vont à l'école. il possède et gère un petit stand dans un quartier de la ville où il vend des produits frais tels que les oranges, anans, citrons, pastèques depuis 20 ans. il sollicite alors ce crédit afin de renforcer son stock de marchandises pour satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante. Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité et le reste sera injecté pour assouvir les besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Moukouri is a 39-year-old unmarried father of three children, all of whom attend school. He owns and runs a small stand in an area of the city where he has sold fresh produce such as oranges, pineapples, lemons, and watermelons for 20 years. He is seeking this loan to expand his stock of merchandise in order to satisfy his growing clientele. Part of the profits derived from this loan will be reinvested in his business, with the remainder being used to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy and sell fresh produce.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. 

Helen is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly to attain of her dream: to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fish selling business in the Philippines.

Lourdes requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: God Will Muluh

texts.fr: GOD WILL MULUH est un jeune homme âgé de 21 ans, très ambitieux dispose comme activité d'une alimentation dans un marché de la ville depuis 03 ans. Il voudrait acheter du riz, des cartons de pattes alimentaires, de tomates, d'huile et de savon pour renforcer son stock de marchandises car il veut commencer la vente en gros, qui génère un peu plus de bénéfices car les marchandises sont écoulés rapidement. Il compte faire des économies pour organiser son mariage.
texts.en: God Will Muluh is a young man, aged 21, who is very ambitious and has owned a business selling food at a market in the town for three years. He would like to buy rice, cartons of pasta, tomatoes, oil, and soap to expand his stock of merchandise because he wants to begin selling in bulk, which will generate a little more profit since the goods are sold very quickly. He intends to save up for his wedding.

loans.use: acheter les marchandises

loans.name: Carole

texts.fr:
Carole est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 31 ans qui mène qui mène une activité de vente de boissons dans un quartier de la ville depuis 03 ans déjà. Malgré sa jeune expérience elle bénéficie d'un portefeuille clientèle considérable. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 40 casiers de boissons pour renforcer son stock et pouvoir mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
elle a pour ambition de faire des économies pour ouvrir un restaurant. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Carole is a young Cameroonian, aged 31, who has run a business selling drinks in an area of the city for three years so far. Despite her limited experience, she has acquired a considerable clientele. With this loan, she would like to buy 40 cases of drinks to expand her stock and be able to better satisfy her customers.
Her ambition is to save up to open a restaurant, which will allow her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Elisabethe

texts.fr: femme Camerounaise de 51 ans, Elisabethe fait dans la vente du poisson frais à la braise depuis plusieurs années dans la ville de Kribi. avec l'argent, elle souhaite acheter le poisson, les boissons hygiéniques, les chaises et les tables afin d'augmenter les places assises dans son local. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinvestis dans l'activité et permettront également à Elisabethe d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: A 51-year-old Cameroonian woman, Esliabethe has run a business selling fresh braised fish for several years in the city of Kribi. With this loan, she hopes to buy fish, health drinks, and tables in order to expand the seating near her stand. The profits earned will be reinvested in her business and will also allow Elisabethe to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fish, health drinks, and tables.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 50 years old, and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She earns a living by selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Marivic requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: Madame Machozi est membre de l'association d'affaire Tuungane. Elle est mariée à un enseignant , mère de 6 enfants qui vont tous à l'école et âgée de 43 ans. Elle étale sa marchandise au marché central de la ville. Ce nouveau crédit va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en 1/2 sac de fretins qu'elle pourra marchander. Le seul obstacle qu'elle rencontre dans l'exercice de son activité c'est la rareté de la marchandise lors de l’approvisionnement. Cependant, elle ambitionne la croissance de son activité pour mieux répondre aux besoins de son ménage et remercie Hekima pour son assistance aux femmes économiquement pauvres.
texts.en: Ms. Machozi is a member of the Tuungane business group. She is 43 years old, married to a teacher, and has six children, all of whom attend school. She displays and sells her goods at the central market in the city. This loan will allow her to supply herself with half a bag of small fry that she will be able to sell. The only difficulty she encounters in running her business is the scarcity of merchandise during procurement. However, her ambition is to expand her business in order to better respond to the needs of her household. She thanks Hekima for providing assistance to economically poor women.

loans.use: To buy half a bag of small fry.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois et il est composé de femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Le responsable madame Diarra est une veuve âgée de  51 ans et mère de 5 enfants dont un garçon et quatre filles.
elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée habillée de grand boubou meuve.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de produits divers, son nouveau crédit de 200000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des habits prêt à porter des paires de chaussures et tissus teintés qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier à des amies.
les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the local village loan fund and comprises women from the same area united by good social and professional relations.
The group leader, Ms. Diarra, is a 51-year-old widowed mother of five children - one sons and four daughters. 
She is standing all the way on the left in the photo, dressed in a large mauve boubou with her hand raised.
She runs a business selling various items, and her new loan of 200,000 FCFA will allow her to buy ready-to-wear clothing, pairs of shoes, and dyed fabric,  which she will resell at retail in her area and to her friends.
The profits realized from this business allow her to take care of her children's nutritional, educational, and health needs.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and dyed fabric for a small business.

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il est composé de femmes du même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
Le responsable madame khady est une femme mariée âgée de 54 ans et mère de de huit enfants dont 4 garçons et 4 filles. Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo la main levée habillée d'un grand boubou vert pointillé.
Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits divers depuis longtemps elle dispose d'une bonne expérience.
Son nouveau crédit de 55000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des paires de chaussures et de l’encens qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants mais également de de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the local village loan fund and comprises women from the same area united by good social relations.
The group leader, Khady, is a 54-year-old married mother of eight children - four sons and four daughters. She is standing all the way on the left in the photo, dressed in a large stippled green boubou with her hand raised.
She has run a business selling various items for a long time, and has good experience in this field.
Her new loan of 55,000 FCFA will allow her to buy pairs of shoes and incense, which she will resell at retail in her area.
The profits realized from this business allow her not only to take care of her children's nutritional and educational needs, but also to strengthen her savings at the local village loan fund.

loans.use: To buy pairs of shoes and incense for a small business,

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y sola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, ahora son ya indepedientes. Ella habita cómodamente en su casa propia, en compañía de su hermano.
La actividad que realiza Digna es el alquiler de cuartos para solteros, serviico que acondiciono en su propia casa, contando con 10 habitaciones cómodas y confortable. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano quien le ayuda en la busca de nuevos inquilinos.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar y construir más cuartos par así aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP y está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como madera y listones para ampliar y construir mas cuartos, buscando conseguir precios bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Digna, 56 years old, is a single working woman who has managed to bring up her children on her own. They are now all now independent. She lives comfortably in her own home, in the company of her brother.
Digna works renting rooms for single people, with air conditioning, in her own home.  She offers 10 convenient and comfortable rooms for rent. She has been at this business for over 3 years and has her brother’s support, who helps her search for new tenants.  
She likes her business as it generates income and allows her to have a job and feel like a productive person. For this reason, she plans to expand and build more rooms in order to increase her income. This loan will be her third with the MFP institution and she is very happy to know that she has such financial support. It makes her feel safe to move forward with her business. With the requested loan amount pf 1000 Peruvian Soles,  she will invest in the purchase of materials such as wood and slats to expand and build more rooms. She is  looking to get lower prices for volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase of materials like wood and slats to expand and build more rooms

loans.name: Oumy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été fondé depuis le 28/05/2009 il est composé de 23 femmes issues du même quartier partageant des valeurs sociales communes.Le responsable madame Ndeye Yacine est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans et mère de 2 enfants dont une fille et un garçon.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo. 
Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience.
Son nouveau crédit de 140000 francs cfa elle va se payer des tubes de lait de toilettes et des bouteilles de parfums  qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier à des amis.
Les bénéfices tirés de son petit commerce l'aident à prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was founded on 28 May 2009 and comprises 23 women from the same area who share common social values. The group leader, Ms. Ndeye Yacine, is a 40-year-old married mother of two children - one son and one daughter.
She is standing all the way on the left in the photo.
She has run a business selling cosmetics for a long time and has gained good experience in this field.
With her new loan of 140,000 FCFA, she is going to buy tubes of lotion and bottles of perfume, which she will resell at retail in her area and to her friends.
The profits from her small business help her take care of her children's nutritional, educational, and health needs.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Isseu's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 28/05/2009 il est composé de femmes d'un même quartier unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
le responsable madame Aida est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans et mère de 7 enfants dont 5 garçons et 2 filles.
Elle debout sur la photo a l’extrême droite la main levée . Aida s'active dans le commerce de poissons depuis bientôt 10 ans elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Son nouveau crédit de 100000 francs cfa va lui permettre de se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va revendre au détails au niveau du quartier.
les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de prendre ne charge les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 May 2009 and comprises women from the same area united by good social and professional relations.
The group leader, Ms. Aida, is a 49-year-old married mother of seven children - five sons and two daughters.
She is standing all the way on the right in the photo with her hand raised. Aida has run a business selling fish for close to ten years and has gained good experience in this field.
Her new loan of 100,000 FCFA will allow her to buy baskets of fresh fish, which she will resell at retail in her area.
The profits from her business allow her to take care of her children's educational and health needs.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish for resale at retail.

loans.name: Ndiougou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 28/05/2009 il est composé de 02 femmes habitant le même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
le responsable madame Ndeye Coumba est une femme mariée âgée de 57 ans et mère de 4 enfants toutes des filles. Elle est debout à gauche de la photo recouvert d'un écharpe multicolore. Elle s'active dans le commerce de patte d'arachide et et fait en même l'aviculture depuis longtemps.
Son nouveau crédit de 445000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer des seaux de patte d'arachide et de poussins qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard.
les bénéfices de son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses filles et d'épargner au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on 28 Mary 2009 and comprises two women who live in the same area and are united by good social and professional relations.
The group leader, Ms. Ndeye Coumba, is a 57-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are girls. She is standing on the left in the photo, wearing a multicoloured scarf. She has run a business selling peanut paste and has also farmed poultry for a long time.
Her new loan of 445,000 FCFA will allow her to buy buckets of peanut paste and young chicks that she will raise and resell later.
The profits from her business allow her to take care of her daughters' nutritional, educational, and health needs, and to increase her savings at the local village loan fund.

loans.use: To buy peanut paste and chicks for poultry farming.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Andrea is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her furniture-making business, like nails, bamboo, paint and hardwood.

Andrea has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to make furniture, like nails, bamboo, paint and hardwood.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 38 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more peanuts and balut to sell to customers.

Aileen has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and balut to sell to customers.

loans.name: Charita

texts.es:
Charita, de 40 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, al momento de quedarse como madre soltera no dudo ningún momento en trabajar en cualquier trabajo que se le presentaba.  Es así como está sacando adelante a su hija, Alith de 16 años de edad.  Vive en su casa propia solo a lado de su hija  a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. A diario la tienda de abarrotes de Charita siempre se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de algún artículo o producto de primera necesidad ya que saben que lo encontraran y que serán atendidos con su amplia sonrisa y un buen trato.  Su negocio está ubicado en un espacio que acondiciono en su casa, atendiendo  desde hace 08 años.  Viene realizando éste trabajo que inició al ver la necesidad de satisfacer algunas necesidades de su hogar.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su negocio pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar en lo que su hija necesite.
Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su menor  hija,  quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarle algunas veces en la atención de sus clientes, ahora desea seguir trabajando mucho y poder comenzar a ampliar y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 05 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado ella se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que no desea quedar mal con su grupo, ya que todos son muy puntuales. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará productos y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceites, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas entre otros, para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Charita, who is 40 years old, is a friendly and hard-working woman. At the moment when she was left a single mother, she did not hesitate for a moment to work in whatever job was available. This is how she is raising her daughter, Alith, who is 16 years old. She lives in her own house along with her daughter, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Every day, Charita's grocery store is always open very early. This is why her many customers come seeking some basic article or product, since they know that they will find it and that they will be waited on with her wide smile and kind treatment. Her business is located in a space that she set up in her house, where she has been tending her business for eight years. She continues doing this work that she began on seeing the need to satisfy some of the needs of her  household.

She feels that her business is quite profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her. She likes her business since she does not have to leave her house much and can help with what her daughter needs.

She very much appreciates the help offered by her young daughter, who is always at her side to help her, sometimes waiting on her customers. Now she wants to continue working hard and to be able to begin to expand and offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since this way she will feel confident of advancing with her business. On her part, she promises once again to make her payments in a punctual manner, since she wants to remain on good terms with her group, since everyone is very punctual. With the amount she has applied for, 2500 PEN, she will buy products and merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, candies, and carbonated beverages, among other items, to be able to offer greater quantities and variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oils, candies, and carbonated drinks, among other items, to be able to offer her customers greater quantities and variety

loans.name: Novy Marie

texts.en:
Novy Marie is 27 years old and married with one kid.

Novy Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell.

Novy Marie has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Novy Marie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 56 years old and married with three children.

Ofelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, sardines, rice, and frozen foods.

Ofelia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a cafeteria.

Ofelia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, sardines, rice, and frozen foods.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Hentry is approaching us for a second loan after he has paid the previous one sucessfully. He is grateful that he was was able to satisfy his customers. He is aspiring to grow his business, which is why he has approached us for a loan amounting to KES 5,000--to expand the business as customers keep increasing.

loans.use: to purchase 16 sacks of fruit.

loans.name: Jess

texts.en: Jess is 36 years old and married with two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, he operates a motorcycle transport service in his community. Jess has been engaged in this business for five years and earns PHP 12,300 each month. Jess joined GDMPC in 2009. Jess is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 to repair an existing vehicle for better services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Juvith

texts.en: Juvith is from Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and single. Juvith owns and operates a fish pond business, raising crabs and fish to sell in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns PHP 10,000 a month. In 2009, Juvith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juvith is requesting a loan of PHP 12,500, which will be used to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and crabs to raise

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa is 24 years of age, is married, and has three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Flordelisa has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture making.

Flordelisa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue on to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en: Bienvinida is married and 45 years old with seven children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, which is planting and harvesting coconut for sale. She's been with her business for 12 years and earns each month of 3,500 PHP. She's requesting a loan of 4,500  to purchase farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is married and has six children. She is 39 years old and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Conchita is operating a fish-selling business venture for a living, while her husband does the fishing. She has been in this business for nine years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,200 doing this type of business. She requesting  a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. In 2009, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is married with two children. She is 42 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She operates a retail store as her main source of income. Lenora earns 5,300 PHP each month and she's been engaged in her business for 10 years. Leonora is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products like soap, rice, canned goods, coffee and sugar. She hopes to extend her business and to help her family in daily living.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like soap, rice, canned goods, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny grows corn crops and raises hogs within his local community. He is 33 years old and married with one child. Johnny's wife operates a restaurant. Aside from raising hogs and corn crops, he also runs a 20,000 square meter fish pond which he rented for 20,000 PHP every five months.

Johnny has run his livestock business for two years. At present, he raises six hogs to be fattened and one sow.

Johnny is full of hopes in life: he wants to obtain more hogs to raise in order for him to gain a better income. For him to realize his goal, he is asking for another loan, amounting to 50,000 PHP. He will be using this loan amount to buy hog feed and vitamins to ensure proper growth of his hogs upon reaching their maturity period. Johnny believes that someday he could be a successful entrepreneur within his locality.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vitamins ensuring proper growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: This is a subsequent loan for Riziki after paying the previous loan successfully. She is grateful for the help given, however she wishes to expand her business due to the growth of her customers, so she applied for a loan amounting to KES 30,000 to stock the store with bags of sugar, rice, cereals, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to stock her store with beverages, canned goods, and baked goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gemima, de 37 años, es una mujer muy generosa, amable y trabajadora. Conviviente con Cesar  quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos. Vive cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos de  16 y  9 años de edad. Ella trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El trabajo de Gemima consiste en la venta de pescado fresco de diversa variedad, su actividad empieza desde muy temprano al ir al puerto de pescadores a comprar pescado fresco de varios precios y  buena calidad. Para luego venderlos al menudeo en el mismo puerto de pescadores  contando con un parlante para llamar a los clientes, brindando a sus clientes los mejores productos nutritivos y deliciosos.  Ésta actividad lo realiza como vendedora ambulante, se inició vendiendo dulces y golosinas, con las ganancias más un capital prestado por MFP incursiono en la venta de pescados.
Lleva realizando éste trabajo por más de 01 año y lo hace con la ayuda de su pareja.
Considera rentable  por que le permite tener ingresos solo trabajando medio día y el resto del tiempo puede dedicar a su familia y su hogar, se siente muy bien ya que genera buenos ingresos y siempre tiene clientes a quienes atiende con una enorme sonrisa y un trato muy amigable. Antes de empezar con éste negocio su dinero no le alcanzaba para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene  planes de  seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio.
Este es el crédito número 05  con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo financiero ya que le dará la garantía de seguir trabajando tranquila. Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará pescado frescos en mayor cantidad y de toda variedad, pues considera que a mayor variedad,  tendrá mayores ventas  y  aumentará sus márgenes  de ganancia.
texts.en:
Gemima, 37, is a very generous, friendly and hardworking woman. She lives with Cesar, who is a merchant and the father of her children. They live comfortably in their own house with their two children, ages 16 and 9. She works a lot to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Gemima sells fresh fish of all kinds. She starts very early, going to the fishing docks to buy good-quality, fresh fish at various price points. Later she often sells them on the same port, using a speaker to call out to her customers. She gives her customers the most nutritious and delicious products. She sells door-to-door. She started out selling candies and snacks, and with her earnings plus a loan from MFP she began selling fish.

She has been doing this work for more than a year and her husband helps her. She thinks it's profitable because she can make money only working a half day and the rest of the time she can dedicate to her family and her home. She feels good that she brings home good income and always has customers, who she takes care of with an enormous smile and friendly demeanor. Before starting her business she didn't have enough money to cover her household expenses. She has plans to keep working to grow her business.

This is her 5th loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she has a financial backer because it gives her the guarantee of continuing to work without worry. She is also very happy to be part of her village bank because all of the members are very responsible and united. 

With the requested 3000 soles, she will buy fresh fish in greater quantities and varieties, because she thinks that with greater variety she will have more sales and improve her profit margins.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish in greater quantity and variety.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like cassava flour, Irish onions, and many other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase such items as milk, sugar, and tea leaves to offer for sale.

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, amable y solidaria. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de su único hija de 29 años de edad.
La actividad que realiza Zulema posee un restaurante en donde expende desayunos y menús como tallarín con pollo, guiso de pollo, picante de carne, etc. Su negocio se encuentra en su propia casa, ahi sus clientes son atendidos de manera amable y cordial, ganándose de esa manera la preferencia de ellos. Y durante los fines de semana venden parrilladas de pollos que son muy requeridos por su buena sazón. Tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su hija es quien más la ayuda, atendiendo a los clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico constante que le sirve para pagar los gastos básicos, además de poder estar en la comodidad de su hogar.  Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de comidas como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros, buscando conseguir precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Zulema, 64, is a hard-working, kind, supportive woman who lives in her own house with her only daughter, who is 29 years old.  Zulema runs a restaurant and serves breakfast and menu items such as chicken and noodles, chicken stew, spicy meat, etc.  Her business is set up in her home, where she attends to her customers cordially, winning over their loyalty.  On weekends she sells roast chicken which is very popular because of its good flavor.  For over 20 years she has been in this business and her daughter is the one who helps out when she can, attending to customers.

She likes her work because it is a constant source of income and covers basic expenses and it is comfortable to be able to work out of her own home.  This is her fourth loan through the MFP institution, so she is counting on your support to carry out her plans.  She is comfortable with her communal bank because she feels it is a united, supportive group.

She plans to use the 1,500 PEN to buy the necessary ingredients for her food preparation, such as rice, sugar, oil and other items.  Her aim is to buy in bulk at lower prices.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as rice, sugar, oil and other items.

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina, de 42 es una mujer amable y buena, tiene 02 hijos, a quienes durante todo el tiempo a su lado les ha brindado educación y una crianza con buenos hábitos. Viven en su casa propia en donde todos aportan para la economía del hogar y así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
El negocio de Carina consiste en el alquiler de mototaxis, a diario van a su casa 02 personas en busca de alquilarle sus 02 unidades móviles, son persona que tiene documentos en regla y sobre todo responsables. 
Lleva realizando éste negocio hace más de 04 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional ya que también trabaja como personal administrativo en la municipalidad de su ciudad.
Le está yendo bien en su negocio, pues percibe dos ingresos y eso le permite poder tener algunas comodidades en su hogar al mismo tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos quienes aun están estudiando. Espera seguir haciendo éste negocio, para más adelante, incrementar su flota con algunos vehículos más. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus vehículos que se encuentran deteriorados por el uso constante y el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Carina, 42, is a kind woman with two children who she always tries to raise giving them a good education and teaching them good habits.  The family lives in their own home and everyone contributes to the household economy in order to lead a better lifestyle.

Carina has a motor-taxi rental business and rents her two vehicles to two people who come to her house daily.  They are responsible people with the necessary permits.

She has been in this business for four years now, providing her with extra income since she also works in administration at the local municipality.

Business is doing well and both incomes allow her to enjoy a few home comforts while also supporting her children who are still in school.  She hopes to continue her business and, in the future, increase her fleet of vehicles.  She plans to use the 1,000 PEN to buy spare parts for vehicle maintenance, since the constant use and passing of time have deteriorated some parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, convive con Dedmer de 49 años, quien es el padre de sus 02 menores hijos, Jimena de 15 años y Herber de 7 años de edad y es por ellos que se esmera para brindarles una calidad de vida. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Diana es la venta de comidas como “juanes” arroz envuelto en hojas de bijao, con pollo; asados, anticuchos y otros. Es así que todos las mañanas instala su mesa en el frontis de la casa de sus padres, ahi ofrece la variedad de comida que prepara. Ella es muy amable al atender a su clientela, pues de esa manera mantiene la preferencia de ellos. 
Se inició hace más de 02 años con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas, y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y que casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender.
Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un poyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por su parte, se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Con el monto solicitado de 1800 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos como arroz, huevos, pescado entre otros, para la preparación de comidas y ponerlas a la venta en su negocio, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, así continuar con éste  negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Diana, 40, is a hard-working woman who lives with Dedmer, 49, the father of her two minor children, Jimena, 15, and Herber, 7.  She does all she can to give them a good quality of life; and they all live together in their own house.  Diana sells food such as "juanes", rice and chicken wrapped in banana leaves, roasts, snacks, etc.  Every morning she sets up a table out in front of her parents' house where she sells her food.  She is very kind to her customers who are loyal to her.

She began her business over two years ago with a private loan, and bought and sold in small quantities.  Later, she increased her volume to meet demand, but still works alone.

She believes her business is quite profitable as she ends up selling almost everything she puts up for sale.  This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is very grateful for this financial support which is sure to help her get ahead in her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with previous loans.  She plans to use the 1,800 PEN to buy ingredients such as rice, eggs, fish, etc., to prepare the food she sells.  She aims to look for the best prices whe doing her shopping so she can continue her work and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients such as rice, eggs, fish, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ilusiones y ganas de progresar. Convive con Delmer quien es docente y  padre de sus 02 hijos de 11 y 04  años de edad. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa inmueble que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Ruth es la venta de frutas regionales como melones y sandias, esto es durante las mañanas, en donde instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa atendiendo a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial; y por las tardes, se dediza en la venta de productos de belleza, que previamente son elegidos por catálogos, ofreciéndoles a sus familiares y amigos. Es así que día a día trabaja para salir adelante. Sus deseos la motivaron a ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, actividad que hasta el momento le esta yendo muy bien y espera mas adelante tener una tienda. Este es el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para concretar sus planes. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de variedad de frutas a precios más bajos para así comprar en volumen, de esa manera espera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ruth, 21, is a woman with many dreams and a determination to get ahead.  She lives with Delmer who is a teacher, and they have two children, ages 11 and 4.  They live comfortably in their own house which they bought through much effort.

Ruth sells regional fruit, such as melons and watermelon.  In the morning she sets up a table out in front of her house where she attends to her customers cordially.  In the afternoons, she sells beauty products from catalogues to relatives and friends.  This is how she earns a living every day to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses.  For now, business is going well and in the future she hopes to have a store.  This is her fifth loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support so she can meet her goals.

She plans to use the 1,000 PEN loan to buy a variety of fruits in bulk at lower prices in an aim to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruits.

loans.name: Ibis

texts.es:
Ibis, de 28 años, es una mujer luchadora, convive con Denis de 26 años, quien es electricista. Juntos tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años de edad, en donde habitan en casa de sus suegros. Todos los días, Ibis se dirige a su refrigerador en donde están los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, como son las bebidas gasificadas y refrescos. estos productos los consigue al por mayor en el mercado de su ciudad. Ya en su casa, lo ordena, en su congeladora. 
Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 05 años y hasta el momento lo hace sola, para ella es muy rentable este negocio, por las ganancias que le deja y la constante demanda.
Es el crédito número 05 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, ella se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y cumplida como en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, para tener en stock disponible para la venta, ya que por el incremento de la temperatura en la zona cada día aumentan las ventas.
texts.en:
Ibis, 28, is a determined woman who lives with Denis, 26, an electrician.  They have two children, ages 7 and 5, and live with her parents-in-law.  Every day, Ibis attends to her customers, offering them refrigerated sodas and soft drinks.  She buys them wholesale at the city market and then organizes them at home in her refrigerator.

She has been in business for five years now and works alone.  Since there is constant demand for her products, business is profitable.

This is her fifth loan through MFP and she is counting on your support to help meet her goals.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with the previous loans.  She plans to use the 2,500 PEN to buy different brands of sodas for her inventory, since the increase in temperature in the area will increase demand.

loans.use: To buy different brands of sodas.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a kiosk water vendor in Kisauni, Mombasa. He is married and his wife produces additional income; together they support three children. He has been in this business for the last six years and he has done well. 

He will use the loan to purchase plastic water pipes to distribute water to his customers. He will use the anticipated profit to pay back his loan. As this is his first loan, he hopes to open up other such business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase plastic water pipes to distribute water.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 43años, es una mujer amable y emprendedora.  Tiene 3 hijos, uno de ellos es mayor e independiente y tiene 27 años, el segundo de 05 años Darcery y Richard de 02 año de edad. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. Rosario, es una mujer que no le teme a los grandes retos, es así que al ver la gran necesidad de dinero que padecía cada mes, decidió vender desayunos de manera delivery, para ello contó con una cartera de clientes entre los que estaban sus compañeros de su anterior trabajo, como operario de limpieza. Han transcurrido 04 años y le esta yendo muy bien. ya que tiene constantes pedidos y nunca le falla a nadie. Se siente tranquila al ver que sus ganancias se incrementan y eso le ayudrá a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este es el crédito número 04 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su trabajo.  Por otro lado, se compromete a seguir siendo puntual y pagar sus cuotas tal como le programen. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevos, pollo, etc.  Para  la preparación de comidas y seguir con su negocio, además de buscará precios al por mayor, de esa manera espera obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario, 43, is a friendly and enterprising woman. She has three children, one of whom is an adult and self-sufficient at 27 years old, her second child, Darcery, is 5 years old and Richard is 2 years old. They live together in their own home. 

Rosario is a woman who is not afraid of tackling major challenges, this is why when she saw the need for money which she was short of every month, she decided to sell delivery-style breakfasts. To do so, she relied on a list of customers that included her co-workers from her previous job where she worked as a cleaner. Four years have passed and the business is going well as she has regular orders and she never lets anyone down. Rosario is pleased when she sees that her profits are growing as this will help her to offer her children a better quality of life. 

This is Rosario's 4th loan with MFP and she is very content knowing that she has financial support as she feels sure of progressing with her work. She pledges to continue being punctual and meet the repayments as scheduled. With the sum of 2,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles, Rosario will buy ingredients and supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs, chicken and so on, all of which is to prepare dishes and to continue with her business, as well as enable her to seek wholesale prices which she hopes will enable her to have larger profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, eggs and chicken.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 38 years old. She lives in Martvili District with her husband and three children. Ekaterine requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. Ekaterine sells nuts and cheese locally at a good price. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence-poor category. 

Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Ekaterine will purchase an oven. After purchasing an oven, she will bake cakes and sell them locally. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase an oven to bake cakes.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Liza works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail.  Liza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet cafe business.

Liza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her internet cafe.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer is engaged in cattle-breeding and crop farming. His family members help him in this work. He has land where he has built a greenhouse and wants to plant tomatoes, cucumbers, beans to grow and sell. In addition he is a master of masonry work. He hopes cropping will bring him a good income, and he also wants to develop his animal husbandry business.

Azer is 49 years old, married and the father of four children. He married-off his two daughters and wants to ensure the future and educational support for his two other children who are at school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and do necessary construction work on the greenhouse.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hog-raiser living in Peñablanca with her two children. She raise hogs to re-sell to butchers upon achieving the desired weight. She makes profits from her business and has been able to give an allowance to her children. 

She would like to keep selling healthy hogs that is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vaccines for hogs. It will ensure good nutrition. She aims to become a successful hog-raiser and keep improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for hogs.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Raising hogs is the business of Clarita. She is 39 years old and married. She has been in the business for three years now. She gains about PHP 2,000 from each hog. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy vaccines and feed so her hogs are sustainable. This will ensure good growth of the hogs and allow her to sell them at a good price. 

In the future, Clarita hopes to keep making the business profitable and save funds for the family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and feed so her hogs are sustainable.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 41-year-old gentleman, married to Grace who operates a green grocery, and a father of one child.

He has operated a butchery in Narok town for the last ten years earning a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of the credit officers and has now acquired his first loan of KES 50,000. He plans to purchase goats to slaughter so as to have additional stocks of meat to sell. 

He plans to use the anticipated profit to plow back into his business to help it expand. He plans to educate his child as well as buy and develop his own plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats to slaughter to have additional stocks of meat to sell.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 32-year-old lady who is married to a business man and is a mother of three children aged 11, eight and four years old. She operates a small shop where she sells mobile accessories.

Marita has acquired a first loan of KES 30,000 with which she will purchase mobile phone accessories. She plans to use the anticipated profits to enlarge her business.

She hopes to own a plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy furniture and health-related tools for a clinic.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 34-year-old general store owner from Bamburi Mtambo, Mombasa. He is a married father of three whose wife provides additional income. He has been in this business for the last five years and has done well. 

He is requesting his first loan to purchase a stock of sugar, packets of milk, loaves of bread and bales of wheat and maize flour.

He will use the anticipated profit to expand his general store business; he hopes to educate his children with the proceeds from his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, packets of milk, loaves of bread and bales of wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children. Issa is the only provider for the family. 

Issa owns a small shop and sells electrical supplies. He established his business in 2009, and now he has two employees. He built a good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Issa is requesting a loan of $2,200 to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her abaca.

Josefina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build-up her abaca weaving business.

NWTF is re-listing Josefina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard used the previous loan to buy fertilizers and pay workers. He is a 44-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been farming bananas and coffee for five years and has recently ventured into fishing. Richard is requesting money to buy fishing nets and boats. His challenges are price fluctuations and inflation. His personal goal is to educate his children, while his business goal is diversifying his businesses to include motorcycle transport.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and boats.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has one child. Abbas is the only provider for the family.
Abbas owns a grocery store selling grains, sugar, salt and flour. He established his business in 2000. He has gained experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
Abbas is requesting a sum of $2,400 loan to buy a motor generator and two new scales. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and two new scales for his grocery store.

loans.name: Tarcesia

texts.en:
Tarcesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

Tarcesia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to improve her business.

NWTF is re-listing Tarcesia's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is from Msambweni Mombasa.  She is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking person who has always worked to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a grocery in a stall near her home. She has it with stocked with fruits and vegetables. She has had it for more than two years and has now gained trust from a wide range of customers.
She is applying for a loan of KSH.15000 to expand her business and buy bunches of bananas, bags of coconuts, and sacks of vegetables. She is grateful for this opportunity and is confident it will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy bunches of bananas, bags of coconuts, and sacks of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy candies and toffees to sell to general stores.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 57 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is in school.

Rosalita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel has paid off his previous loan and is now preparing for another planting season. His last harvest paid off well and he has since managed to lease an extra piece of land for maize planting.

He has acquired a loan of KES 100,000 which will facilitate him in preparing his larger piece of land, and buying seedlings and other farm inputs .

He will use his anticipated gains to educate his children. He hopes to buy a large piece of land and build the family a permanent house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on another person's plot of land. He teaches clients how to drive automobiles at a driving center. His wife operates their own grocery store. His elder son goes to secondary school while his younger son stays at home. 

He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase food stuffs in large quantity. The reason is that at this time, the national holiday as known as White moon is celebrated and demand for food stuffs increases drastically. As a consequence, they can generate more income from their grocery store. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase food stuffs in large quantity.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a single youth client, 24 years of age, who lives with nine family members, of whom three are employed.
Ahmad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He has built a good reputation in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area. 
Ahmad is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to renovate his shop and to install signage and a rolling shutter for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and install signage and a rolling shutter at his grocery store.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 31-year-old married mother of two children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has had a general store business in the Philippines for three years. 

Cherry has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items for her store, such as bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, spices and other groceries for her general store.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, de 45 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Petronila y sus 3 hijos: Jordi, Jhony y Melisa, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 7 años.
Desde las primeras horas de la mañana se dirige a trabajar en las construcciones que tiene, mientras que su esposa se queda cuidando su tienda de comestibles. Cuenta que su especialidad por más de 15 años se centra en el acabado final de las casas, es decir colocar las ventanas, realizar el piso, enchapados de mayólicas y parquet, además de realizar fogones para las salas y demás detalles del acabado de las casa, “es vital tener un buen criterio pues depende mucho de ello si sin estéticos y mis clientes queden contentos”, afirma. Es así que tiene mucha demanda y espera poder mejorar sus ingresos pues siempre tiene que renovar sus instrumentos para que pueda tener un buen acabado, motivo por el que desea un pequeño apoyo económico. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Cesar, invertirá el dinero en la compra de herramientas de trabajo y un poco de dinero en implementar su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Cesar, 45, is a responsible man. He lives with his wife Petronila and their three children: Jordi, Jhony and Melisa, who he looks after in the home he bought seven years ago.

From the early hours in the morning, Cesar goes to work in the building sites he owns while his wife stays behind to run the grocery store. He recounts that his speciality for more than 15 years is finishing homes i.e. installing windows, laying the floor, ceramic and floor tiles as well as fireplaces in living rooms and other home finishing and decorative details. "It is vital that to have good judgement as a lot depends on it, and my customers are happy with the results," says Cesar. It is because of this ethic that he has so much demand and he hopes to be able to improve his income as he always needs to renew his tools to ensure good finishing, hence the reason for which Cesar is seeking a bit of financial support. 

This is Cesar's third loan with MFP where he hopes to rely on your help to continue meeting his objectives. Once again he pledges to meet the repayments. Cesar likes being part of his communal bank as all the members are responsible and supportive people. Cesar will invest the money in the purchase of work tools and a bit of money will go towards setting up the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old, married and has two children. She has been successfully running a small pig-raising business for three years now. She hopes to keep the business running profitably. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy medicines and feed for her pigs.

In the future, Rosa would like to keep maintaining good sales and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy medicines and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 28 años es una mujer hermosa. Vive en compañía de Pablo, su esposo desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Rosa y Josmel, a quienes cuida en su casa propia. 
Ella es una mujer trabajadora, ya que mientras su esposo trabaja en una empresa como chofer, trasportando diversos alimentos a todo el país. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, los cuales vende cada 3 meses según pedidos. Gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio logró obtener 200 ejemplares, los cuales aumenta con facilidad, pues sabe los separa de acuerdo a parentesco, embarazo y edad, de esta manera obtiene mejor resultado en la crianza. Además tiene 4 toros pequeños, que espera criarlos para venderlos de la misma manera. Su secreto es sembrar alfalfa, de esa manera puede brindarles un buen alimento y minimizar costos. Asimismo, por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de carne en un puesto que alquila en el mercado central de la ciudad.  Ahora desea obtener una granja bien implementada, con la ayuda de su esposo quien obtiene buenas ganancias en su trabajo, espera concretarlo.
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 15  con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Evelyn; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más carne para su venta, asimismo en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
28 year old Evelyn is a beautiful woman. She lives with Pablo, her husband of 3 years. They have 2 children: Rosa and Josmel, who they care for in their own home.
She is a hardworking woman. Her husband works for a business as a driver, transporting different foods all around the country. She works raising guinea pigs which she sells to order every 3 months. Thanks to her efforts and sacrifice she has been able to obtain 200 animals, which increase easily, and she knows to separate them according to kinship, pregnancy, and age to get the best results in breeding. She also has 4 small bulls and she hopes to breed those to sell in the same manner. Her secret is growing alfalfa so that she can give them good food and minimize costs. In the mornings, she works selling meat from a stall that she rents in the central market of the city. Now she wants to get a well set-up farm and, with the help of her husband who makes a good wage in his work, she expects to achieve this. She belongs to the loan group The Entrepreneurs and this is her 15th loan from MFP. She is grateful for their support, with which she will reach her goals. On the other hand, she promises to complete her repayments. She also likes being part of the group and has known everyone for many years. 
Evelyn will use the money she is requesting to buy more meat to sell and will buy nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 28 years of age, who is married and has two children. Ali is the only provider of the family.

Ali is a carpenter. He established his business in 2006, and now he has three employees. He has built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ali is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a youth loan to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a piece of equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina, de 36 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compañía de sus 3 hermosos hijos, a los que cuida en casa de su suegra, desde hace 8 años. Su coraje y esfuerzo lo refleja en su trabajo. Su actividad económica se centra en la agricultura y ganadería. Ya tiene 8 años de experiencia en este negocio. Gusta de pasar la mayor parte en el campo, pues su casa se ubica en una zona rural, donde puede criar a sus ganados, los que divide una parte en la casa de su mamá, pues ahí tiene más campo para cuidarlos. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de los animales en su mayoría ganado vacuno, los cuales engorda por un periodo promedio de 4 meses, para después venderlos en la feria ganadera de la ciudad, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. “Me gusta mucho negociar, pues si no obtengo buenas propuestas postergo la venta del animal para otra ocasión mejor”, comenta muy alegre. Ahora desea mejorar su negocio e incursionar con más capital en la agricultura. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Saturnina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
36 year old Saturnina is a woman who strives hard. She lives with her 3 beautiful children who she has been caring for in her mother-in-law's house for 8 years. Her courage and efforts are reflected in her work. Her work is centered on agriculture and livestock. She has 8 years of experience in this business. She likes to spend most of her time in the fields and her house is located in a rural area where she can raise her cattle, and she spends part of her time at her mother's house as there is more land there to raise them. Her work consists of buying animals, beef cattle for the most part, which she raises and fattens for an average of 4 months and then she sells them in the cattle market in the city, from which she makes good profits. "I really like to negotiate. Well, if I don't get good offers, I postpone the sale of the animal for a better time." she comments, very cheerfully. Now she want to improve her business and invest more capital in her farming. She belongs to the loan group The Entrepreneurs and this is her second loan from MFP. She is grateful for the support, with which she will be able to achieve her goals. She also promises to make her repayments on time. She also likes being part of the group and has known everyone for a long time.
Saturnina will use the loan to buy a small bull.

loans.use: to buy a small bull.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is a single youth client, 22 years of age, who lives with five of his family members, of whom two are employed.

Haydar owns a shop and sells electrical goods like televisions, ovens, heaters and refrigerators. He established his business in 2010. He has built up good experience in this field and he is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Haydar is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a youth loan to renovate his shop and to expand his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself a promising career.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and expand his inventory

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 44 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married  and has five children with one of them currently in school. For the past four years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her bar and lodge, which offers lodging facilities and beverages. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy more beer, spirits and wine to sell, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits and more income. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the lodging facilities. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to improve the business and buy more beer, spirits and wine to sell

loans.name: Hadi

texts.en:
Hadi is from Iraq. He is 55 years old, married and has an only child who assists him in providing the family income. 

Hadi owns a small shop and specializes in renting out construction material. He established his business in 2011, after working in this field since his childhood. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hadi is requesting a sum of $2,700 as a loan to purchase equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his child a good future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 37 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: José Andrés y Janeth a los que cuida en la casa que adquirió hace 6 años. 
Es una mujer admirable, pues cuida de sus hijos, sola. Se ingenia para poder ganar dinero, ya que su único sustento es la crianza de cerdos, cuenta con 15 ejemplares; que engorda y cuida con mucha dedicación , ya que vende su carne por pedidos y en ocasiones le comprar vivos, “todo depende del cliente”, afirma. Le va muy bien en este negocio, obtiene buenos ingresos que le permiten criar a sus hijos. Pero para llevar un ingreso extra al hogar también trabaja como peón en diferentes sembríos por temporadas de cosecha como también en las ladrilleras de su localidad. Pues su objetivo es aprovechar la temporada para que le paguen mucho más. Ahora desea abrir un restaurante en su casa, ya que no existe una en su localidad y el comercio es intenso, por ello quiere aprovechar esa necesidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos. 
Julia, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
37 year old Julia is a responsible woman. She lives with her 2 children: José Andrés and Janeth and she cares for them in the house she bought 6 years ago.
She is an admirable woman and cares for her children alone. She manages to earn money and her only business is raising pigs. She has 15 head of pigs which she fattens and raises with great dedication. She then sells the meat to order and occasionally people buy them live. "It all depends on the customer." she says. The business is doing well and she makes good profits that enable her to raise her children. But, in order to bring some extra money into the home, she also works as a farm laborer on various farms during the harvest season and also in the brickworks in her area. Her goal is to take advantage of the season when they pay more. Now she wants to open a restaurant in her house as there isn't one in the area and there are a lot of businesses so she wants to take advantage of their need. She belongs to the loan group The Entrepreneurs and this is her third loan from MFP. She is grateful for their support, which which she will achieve her goals She also promises to make her repayments on time. She also likes being part of the group and has known everyone for a long time.
Julia will use the money she is requesting to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Wathek

texts.en:
Wathek is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and has four children. Wathek is the only provider for the family. He is a cowman. He specializes in making dairy products. He established his business in 1995. He built up good experience in this field and he has become well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Wathek is requesting a sum of $1,800 to buy a new cow. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new cow.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 31 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Elmer y sus 2 hijos: Elmer y Diego a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 3 años. Comenta que gusta mucho del trabajo en el campo, su principal especialidad es la crianza de cuyes y ahora desea ingresar en la crianza de vacas, pues mira un buen ingreso en la producción de leche. “Por el momento mis principales ingresos se centran en la compra y venta de cuyes”, afirma, es muy buena en su trabajo tanto así que trabaja con una empresa comercializadora, llevando la carne de cuy a los principales supermercados del país. Su capital de trabajo es rotativo y siempre necesita liquidez, ya que la empresa le solicita un promedio de 300 cuyes a la semana, por esa razón tiene que comprar a otros ganaderos. Su secreto es criar los cuyes con el pasto que ella misma produce además de comida balanceada para que crezcan con muchos nutrientes.
