Este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Celia, invertirá el dinero en la compra de más cuyes y comida balanceada para los mismos.
texts.en:
Celia, 31, is a modest woman. She lives with her husband Elmer and their 2 children, Elmer and Diego who she cares for in the home she bought three years ago. She says that she very much enjoys working in agriculture, with her main specialty being that of rearing guinea pigs, and she now wants to start raising cattle as she considers milk production to be a good source of income. "For the moment, my main income comes from the purchase and sale of guinea pigs," says Celia. She is very good at her job, so much so that she works with a marketing company, selling guinea pig meat to the main supermarkets in the country. 

Her working capital is a rotating one and she always needs liquid assets given that the business needs on average 300 guinea pigs per week, this is the reason for which she needs to buy them from other farmers. Her secret is rearing guinea pigs with grass which she produces herself as well as nutritionally balanced food so that they go with a lot of nutrients. 

This is Celia’s 17th loan with MFP where she hopes to rely on its collaboration to continue with its objectives. She promises once again to meet the repayments. She also enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive. Celia will invest the money in the purchase of more guinea pigs and nutritionally balanced food for them.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and nutritionally balanced food for them.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 49 años, es una mujer admirable. Hace 4 años que falleció su esposo, con quien tuvo 3 hijos: Luis, Estefania y Andrés. Ahora ella cuida de ellos en casa de su madre, donde vive desde que nació.  Ella afronta los problemas con mucho optimismo, aunque se siente triste por la perdida de su compañero. Todos los días pide la bendición de Dios para que su negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas, le brinde buenas ganancias ya tiene clientes fijos, que constantemente la buscan en el mercado mayorista que es donde ella lleva a vender. Cuenta que en fechas festivas, vende la carne de los animales, “ahí obtengo más ganancia”, afirma. A pesar de la pensión que recibe por la muerte de su esposo, elle sigue trabajando, pues no le alcanza el dinero, sus hijos todavía son pequeños y estudian. Por esa razón planea incrementar sus animales, hasta tener una granja grande y de calidad, para poder obtener mejores ganancias. Este es el crédito número 17 con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Rosa; invertirá el dinero en la compra de gallinas y cuyes, además de comida balanceada para la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 49, is an admirable woman. Some four years ago, her husband with whom she had three children, Luis, Estefania and Andrés, passed away. She now looks after them in her mother's home, where she has lived since she was born. Rosa tackles problems with a lot of optimism, even though she feels sad about the loss of her partner. 

Every day, she seeks God's blessings for her business whereby she sells guinea pigs and chicken which is providing her with good profits as she has regular customers who constantly look in the wholesale market where she brings her goods to sell. During national holidays, Rosa sells meat, "That’s where I gain larger profits." Despite the widow's allowance she receives, she continues to work as the money doesn't stretch far enough; after all, her children are still young and are studying. This is why she plans to increase the number of animals she owns to continue meeting her objectives. 

Rosa once again promises to meet the repayments. She also likes being part of her communal bank as all the members are responsible and supportive people. Rosa will invest the money to buy chicken and guinea pigs as well as nutritionally balanced food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy chicken and guinea pigs, as well as nutritionally balanced food to feed her animals.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has two children. Ali is the only provider in the family. He is a barber. After working for a long time with his father, who is also a barber, and gaining the necessary experience in this field, he established his business in 2000, and now he has an employee. He has acquired good experience in this field, and he is well known with an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Ali is requesting a loan of $2,400 to pay the annual rent on his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married and is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transport.

loans.name: Bedetha

texts.en:
Bedetha is 32 years old and married with one child. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a used clothing & shoe business in the local community. She's been with her business for five years to earn a living and earns 10,300 PHP every month from her business. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010. 

Bedetha is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like used clothing and shoes. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to  purchase additional products to sell like used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Wafae

texts.en:
Wafae is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She is the only provider for the family. Wafae owns a small shop and specializes in tailoring women's outfits. She established her business in 1991. She built up good experience in this field and she has become well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

She is requesting a sum of $2,400 to renovate her workplace and to buy two new tailoring machines. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her workplace and buy two new tailoring machines.

loans.name: Hakmeh

texts.en:
Hakmeh is from Iraq. She is 66 years old and has a single child. Hakmeh lives with four of her relatives. She and her son provide the family income. She owns a small farm and specializes in raising hens and cows and selling dairy products. She established her business in 1990. She built up good experience in this field and she has become well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hakmeh is requesting a sum of $2,400 to buy a cow. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she will be able to buy a bigger farm and more cows.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida, de 43 años es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de Fernando, su esposo. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia. Se siente desarrollada; pues gracias al esfuerzo de su esposo y ella misma pudo adquirir una fábrica de ladrillos. Cuenta que todos la ayudan: sus hijas y yernos; por eso se siente feliz, ya que puede brindar un apoyo a su familia, “el trabajo es muy duro y se necesita de muchas personas”, afirma Zenaida. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en su negocio, es por ello que siempre cuenta con pedidos de clientes fijos. Al mes realiza 22 millares vendiendo estos a buen precio en la misma fábrica sin tener que trasladarlos a otro lugar. Ahora desea comprar nuevos hornos de mayor tecnología, pues solo lo realiza de manera rústica el quemado de los ladrillos que realiza junto a su familia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 19 con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
Zenaida; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de aserrín para la realización de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
43 year old Zenaida is a serious woman. She lives with Fernando, her husband. They have 7 children, but only 5 of them live with them in their house. She feels that things are developing well as, thanks to her husband's efforts and her own efforts, she was able to buy a brickworks. Her daughters and sons help her there and so she is happy and she can offer support to her family. "The work is very hard and requires many people", Zenaida says. She already has 20 years of experience in this business and so she always has orders from established customers. She makes 22,000 a month and sells these at a good price right from the factory without having to transport them to somewhere else. Now she wants to buy new kilns that use better technology as now the family only have rustic means of heating the bricks. She is a member of the loan group The Entrepreneurs and this is her 19th loan from MFP. She is grateful for their support, with which she will achieve her goals. She promises to make her repayments on time. She also likes being part of the group and has known everyone for a long time.
Zenaida will use the money she is requesting to buy sawdust for making the bricks.

loans.use: to buy sawdust for making bricks.

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Ma. Socorro works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jennifer is taking out another loan to expand her business further. This is after successfully repaying her previous loans. She has used her previous loans to expand her business but her customer range is keeping on increasing, and that why is she thinks the market is not fully utilized, hence she needs to expand the business. That is why she approached Yehu for the loan.  

She is grateful to  Kiva lenders and Yehu for providing loans to boost her business and change her living standards.

loans.use: to add stock to her business and to purchase hair oil products and a blow dryer.

loans.name: Dolphina

texts.en:
Delphina is 36 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are still in school. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya. She has a garden where she plants vegetables and fruits so as to supply them to customers. She sells from her home and also around the city.

She says that recently her farm has produced more harvest than her immediate customers could consume. Therefore, she is planning to transport her goods to Nairobi, the largest city in Kenya, for a better market. She is asking for a loan amounting to KSH 40,000 so that she can keep her business running as she ventures to the new market, thereby expanding her business.

She is grateful that such an opportunity has come into being.

loans.use: to transport her goods to a better market.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia tiene 40 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: David y Jack y juntos habitan en su casa propia.  Ella es una mujer admirable, sola ha tenido que afrontar la educación y crianza de sus hijos. Para ello trabaja sin descanso en el mercado de su ciudad, donde vende carne de gallina, trozada, por kilos y empanadas; ya tiene 4 años dedicándose a esto y es muy conocida por sus clientes, que saben de la calidad de carne que vende. Y durante las tardes se dedica a tienda, negocio que abrió hace un año, ofreciendo carnes, menestras, leche y demás productos. Y como si fuera poco, tambien cría vacas, cerdos, cuyes, gallinas y pavos que comercializa cuando los engorda. Además invierte sus tierras con una socia, para la elaboración de ladrillos; ella pone la tierra y su socia la arcilla y chala para quemar los ladrillos. Al mes obtiene buenas ganancias, que le sirven para mantener los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 15 con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de carne de gallina para su negocio, además de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is 40 years old, she lives with her two children, David and Jack, and they live together in their own home. Silvia is an admirable woman, she had to educate and raise her children on her own. To do so, she works tirelessly in her town market where she sells chopped chicken meat, per kilo, and empanadas. She has been working in this field for four hours and is well-known by her customers who know that she sells quality meat. In the afternoon, she works in the store, a business that she opened one year ago, selling meat, vegetable soup, milk and other products. As if that were not enough, Silvia also rears cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, chicken and turkeys which she sells when they are fattened up. 

Silvia is also investing her land with a business partner in order to produce bricks - she provides the land and her business partner provides the clay and soil to form the bricks. She obtains solid profits every month which are used to cover the household costs and those of her children. She belongs to the "Los Emprendedores" communal bank and this is the 15th loan with MFP, which is why she is grateful for its support which will help her to achieve her objectives. Silvia will invest the money requested in the purchase of chicken meal for her business as well as basic goods for her store.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat for her business.

loans.name: Scolasticah

texts.en: Scolasticah is requesting a loan amounting to KSH 50,000 to expand her poultry business, this after successfully paying her previous loan. She is grateful for this great opportunity which has helped her to establish herself and gain a good number of customers, thereby creating the need to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, de 56 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y amable. Está casado con Graciela quien es ama de casa y madre de sus dos hijos William y Clarita de 20 y 18 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos están muy bien instalados en su propia casa que compraron con el fruto de sus ahorros.
La actividad que realiza Carlos es la venta de pescados frescos, para eso se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige al puerto más cercano a comprar su mercadería, luego se dirige a los asentamientos humanos y pueblos jóvenes donde realiza la venta de manera ambulantge por las calles cargando su bandeja y ofreciendo de casa en casa durante toda la mañana. 
Se inició hace más de 02 años con un capital propio y hasta el momento lo viene realizando solo.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias, ayudandolo a cumpliar con los gastos de su hogar. 
Por otro lado, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene con su negocio, con las ganancias desea invertir en una bodega de venta de  abarrotes en su casa, donde atendería su pareja para así apoyarse mutuamente con los gastos del hogar, logrando brindar  una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que tendrá, que le servirá para avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado, se siente a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene recibiendo por parte de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería buscando otras variedades de pescados, además de arreglar su casa para implementar una bodega de venta de abarrotes, empezando con pocas cantidades de productos.
texts.en:
56 year old Carlos is a hardworking and friendly man. He is married to Graciela who looks after the house and their two children, William and Clarita who are 20 and 18 years old respectively. Together, they are very well set-up in their own house which they bought with their savings. Carlos works selling fresh fish, to do this he gets up very early in the morning and drives to the nearest port to buy his merchandise. Then he drives to the settlements and new towns where he sells in the street, carrying his tray from house to house throughout the day.
He began this business more than 2 years ago with his own capital and he works alone.
He considers his business to be quite profitable and it helps him to keep up with the household expenses. On the other hand, seeing the success he has had with his business, he wants to use the profits to invest in a grocery store in his house where his wife could work so that they could share the household expenses and offer a better quality of life to their children. This will be his fourth loan with MFP. He is grateful for the financial help that he will have, which will help him to advance his plans. He is also pleased with his community bank because of the support her receives from the other members. 
He will use the requested loan of $800 to buy a greater variety of fish as well as to add-on to his house so he can open a grocery store, starting out with a small amount of goods.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish.

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en: Lourgen is 37 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. Lourgen has operated a motorcycle rental business for six years, earning a monthly income of 12,500 PHP from it. She is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP to purchase tires and spare parts used in the business. In 2009, Lourgen joined GDMPC. She hopes to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 67 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business, selling unhulled rice. She's been with her business for five years. She earns 6,200 PHP in income every month. 

Linda joined GDMPC in the year 2007, and she is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase a vehicle for the rice grains. She wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for the rice grains

loans.name: Khakakho Group

texts.en:
Roselyne is pictured on the right with her hand raised, amongst her Khakakho Group members. The 15 of them, 12 women and 3 men, are farmers in Bungoma South District. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Roselyne is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited about the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.


Roselyne described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes that as a One Acre Fund farmer she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Roselyne's group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize,  millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married, and blessed with four children that she supports. She has been running a retail shop for the last four years, getting a monthly income of approximately KES 22,000. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products, like bales of maize flour, sugar, and rice.

The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion. Her future dream is to be successful in life

loans.use: to restock her general store with a variety of consumable products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman and she is 65 years old with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting rice for sale. She's been with her business for 20 years and she earns 20,000 PHP each month. 

Erlinda joined GDMPC in the year 2006, and now she's requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is 50 years old and married with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business of harvesting bananas to sell. She's been with her business for 17 years and she earns about 2,000 PHP every month. Ella joined GDMPC in 2008 and now she is requesting a loan of 2,500 PHP to purchase additional seedlings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. Kasem is the only provider of the family.

Kasem owns a small shop selling tools and supplies. He established his business in 2009, and now he has an employee. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kasem is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a loan to pay the yearly rent for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children. Haydar is the only provider of the family.

Haydar owns a blacksmith's shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He established his business in 2009, and now he has two employees. He has built up good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Haydar is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to buy a motor generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions and a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chompas, venta de ropa, venta de artículos varios, tejido de chompas, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las compañeras de su grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en lana de alpaca; cuenta que este negocio lo desde sus 15 años y hasta ahora que tiene 55 lo maneja, siendo 40 años de trabajo en esta área.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de alpaca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank Flor De Haba is starting the second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It has eight members and is headed by a board with Luisa as president. The members of the communal bank have various businesses, among which are: selling sweaters, selling clothes, selling this and that, knitting sweaters, and selling fruit.

The credit they are taking will benefit the micro entrepreneurs where Luisa is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, joining by invitation of friends in the group who are members of the institution. Currently she has a business weaving alpaca wool. She has been in this business since she was 15 years up until now at 55 years old, making 40 years of working in this field.

The loan she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy alpaca wool) that she will buy in the markets in the city of El Alto, at wholesale, and later sell her creations by taking orders. This form of work permits her to earn income in order to support the family, as she lives with a partner and she has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the sessions on health and savings.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, age 24, is a tailor. She is unmarried and lives with four family members, two of whom are employed. 

Miriam has been running her tailoring business in her home since 2011. She has built up good experience in this field and she is well-known in her local area. She has an excellent reputation.

Miriam is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $2,100 in order to buy two new modern tailoring machines. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, allowing her to be better able to provide herself and her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new modern tailoring machines

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Luis quien es comerciante y padre de sus 3 hijos Jouliet, Luis y Luciano de 7, 5 y 1 años de edad respectivamente.  Juntos habitan cómodamente en una casa alquilada en compañía de su hermana y su sobrino.
La actividad que realiza Ana es la venta de frutas de la region donde vive y de refrescos de diversos sabores. Para eso instala todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde acomoda sus frutas y sus refrescos y los oferta, logrando tener buena acogida por su trato amable y el buen sabor de sus refrescos. 
Se inicio hace más de 2 años con un préstamo de MFP, y hasta el momento los viene realizando ella sola, pero en ocasiones le apoya su hermana.
Asimismo considera a su negocio bastante rentable por los ingresos que le deja y la buena acogida que tiene su negocio.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por necesidad de contar con un oficio para generarse sus propios ingresos, además que en ocasiones los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba, tomando la decisión de apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , buscando brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, desea continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de abarrotes para eso quiere abrir una bodega en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibirá, de esa manera se sentirá más segura para avanzar con sus planes.
Con el monto solicitado de 700 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas para surtir su negocio, también en frutas variadas buscando precios cómodos por sus compras para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old. She is a hardworking woman who really wants to get ahead. She lives with Luis, who is a merchant and the father of three children, named Jouliet, Luis and Luciano, aged 7, 5 and 1 respectively. Together they live comfortably in a rented house with her sister and nephew.

Ana's activity is selling fruit from the region where she lives and various flavors of drinks. For this she sets up a table every day in front of her house where she puts out her fruit and drinks and offers them for sale.  She has a good clientele because she is friendly and her drinks are delicious. She started more than 2 years ago with a loan from MFP. So far, she has been doing it alone, but at times her sister helps her.

She considers her business to be very profitable because of the income it brings in and the popularity of it. She started her business out of necessity of having a trade to generate her own income. also, sometimes her spouse' income wasn't enough, and she decided yo help with the household expenses. 
She did this to offer her children a better quality of life.

Now, seeing the good results she is having, she wants to continue with her business and get into selling groceries. To do that, she wants to open a small store in her house. This will be loan number 4 with the MFP institution. She is grateful for the financial support she will receive. This way, she will feel safer going forward with her plans. 

With the amount of 700 nuevos soles she has asked for, she will invest in buying sodas to stock her business. She will also get various fruits, seeking good prices for her purchases so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and sodas.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es casado tiene dos  hijos, vive en casa familiar, ocupando una habitación en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de machihembre, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  Barrio Ferroviario, de la ciudad de La Paz.

Abel estudió hasta secundaria, está empleado y actualmente trabaja como repartidor de Pollos a la broasther, también tiene dos movilidades (taxis) de los cuales percibe ingresos que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. 

El crédito lo requiere para comprar repuestos (pastillas de frenos, filtro de aire y filtro de gasolina) para reparación y mantenimiento de una de sus  movilidades.
 
El sueño de Abel, es tener buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda con KIVA.
texts.en:
Abel is married and has two children.  He lives in a relative’s house, occupying one room with brick finishing and a wood floor.  The house is in the Barrio Ferroviario area of the city of La Paz.

Abel went to school up to high school.  He is employed, and he currently works delivering roasted chicken.  He also has two taxis from which he gets income to help cover the family expenses.

He needs the loans to buy replacement parts (brake pads, air filter, and gasoline filter) for repair and maintenance on one of his vehicles.

Abel’s dream is to have good income in order to improve his quality of life.

This is the second time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the second time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts and pay for maintenance on one of his taxis.

loans.name: Jasem

texts.en:
Jasem, age 28, is a grocer. He and his wife have three children. Jasem is the only provider for the family.
 
Jasem owns a small grocery store that sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2011. He has built up good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation.
 
Jasem is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $1,800 in order to renovate his shop and to install a display window. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, which will allow him to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install a display window

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Hace 24 años enviudó, desde entonces cuida de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos; en su casa que compró hace 5 años.

A pesar de que sus hijos son mayores y ya conformaron su familia. Ella continua viviendo con ellos, pues siempre soñó con criar a sus nietas. Su principal actividad económica es la crianza de ganado vacuno, posee 5 vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen y las vende a sus vecinos quienes conocedores de la rica leche que producen sus animales le comprar todos los días. Además de criar ovejas y gallinas para su consumo, pero cuenta que si tiene cualquier eventualidad los vende engordándolos al mercado. Pero la actividad que le ayudó a criar a sus hijos, sola, es el bordado de fustanes típicos que comercializa a buen precio, ya que tarda mucho tiempo en terminar de bordarlos. Ahora solo realiza un promedio de uno al mes, porque ya no tiene la necesidad de antes. Por el momento desea vivir mucho tiempo para ver a sus nietas crecer y a velar por su familia. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de bebidas por javas para su tienda de comestibles y si el dinero le alcanza comprará alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She is a humble woman. She was widowed 24 years ago and since then has taken care of her 4 children She only lives with 3 of them now in her house, which she bought 5 years ago.

Despite the fact that her children are grown and have made their own families, she still lives with them, because she always dreamed of raising her granddaughters. Her main economic activity is raising cattle. She has 5 cows from which she extracts milk which she sells to her neighbors who know how delicious the milk is that her animals produce. They buy from her every day. She also raises sheep and chickens for her own consumption,   but she says that if she runs into any setback she sells them fattened up for the market. But the activity that helped her raise her children alone is the embroidery of traditional skirts that she sells at a good price, since it takes a long time to finish the embroidery. Now she makes an average of one a month, because she doesn't have as much need as she did before. Right now she wants to live for a long time to see her granddaughters grow and to watch over her family. She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” group, and this is her sixth loan with MFP. She is grateful for your support. With it, she will be able to achieve her goals. She promises to make her payments and she likes being a part of her association, because they have known each other for many years.

María will invest the money she has asked for in buying crates of beverages for her store and if there is enough she will buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to buy crates of beverages for her store.

loans.name: Dúo Triunfadoras De Cañadas Group

texts.es:
DUO TRIUNFADORAS DE CAÑADAS
Doña Nohelia de 43 años de edad,es negociante desde hace varios años, doña Nohelia líder de este grupo desde muy temprano viaja al mercado de San Juan Sacatepéquez  para lograr vender los pasteles que ella elabora todos los días, para esto cuenta con la ayuda  de su hija de 17 años de edad, también viaja hacia la Aldea Loma Alta para vender útiles escolares, juguetes entre otras cosas afueras de la escuela  central de esta localidad, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de pasteles.
texts.en:
Dúo Triumfadoras De Cañadas

Nohelia, age 43, has been a businesswoman for several years.  Nohelia is the leader of this group.  She travels to the San Juan Sacatepéquez market very early in order to manage to sell the cakes that she makes every day.  In order to do so, her 17 year old daughter helps her.  

She also travels to the Aldea Loma Alta in order to sell school supplies and toys, among other things.  She sells in the areas around the central school there.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make cakes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make cakes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María del Pilar, de 48 años, es una trabajadora madre soltera. Vive en compañía de 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su mamá hace 10 años. Desde que conformó su familia tuvo que pasar muchos problemas económicos, sus principales ingresos en aquel entonces se centraba en la agricultura, con la siembra de diversos productos alimenticios. Pero hace pocos años, tuvo una idea de negocio y alquiló un puesto céntrico en el mercado de la ciudad, donde vende carne de pollo, por kilos y trozos. Su trabajo lo realiza con el apoyo de su hermana, quien le ayuda en atender a los clientes. “Me va bien, comienzo a vender desde muy temprano, para el medio día terminó con todo los pollos que llevo a vender , además durante las festividades vendo mucho más”, comenta. Ahora desea aumentar su capital para poder obtener más ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María del Pilar, invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios pollos para su venta, pues diariamente mueve un número considerable de capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
María del Pilar is 48 years old. She is a hardworking single mother. She lives with her 2 children, whom she cares for in the house she inherited from her mother 10 years ago. Since she started her family she has had to go through a lot of financial hardships. Her main income back then was based in agriculture, planting different food crops. But a few years ago, she had a business idea and rented a centrally located place in the city market where she sells chicken by the kilo and in parts. She does her job with the help of sister, who assists in serving customers. “It's going well for me. I start selling very early but by noon I have sold out of all of the chicken I have. Also, during holidays I sell a lot more," she says. Now she wants to increase her capital to make more income. She belongs to the “Los Emprendedores” support group. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support. With it, she will achieve her goals. She also promises to make her payments. She likes being a part of her association, because they have known each other for many years. 

María del Pilar will invest the money in buying several chickens to sell, because she moves a considerable amount of working capital every day.

loans.use: to buy several chickens.

loans.name: Maranatha 1 Group

texts.en:
Marie, age 40, is a member of the Maranatha 1 group. Marie sells bread with assorted toppings at her local market. Many people stop at these small bread stands for a quick lunch or snack during the day. She provides several options to put on the bread, including cheese, sausage, chocolate, butter, and peanut butter. She has had this business for 19 years. She has gained many valuable regular customers over the years. 

She will use the loan funds to buy more bread, butter, chocolate spread, peanut butter, and sausage. Her business strategy is to offer good customer service and to always have the toppings her customers want.

She and her husband have a 15-year-old child who is currently attending school. 
 
Marie has received three previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. Her goal is to gain more clients and grow her business. 

She wants her child to have a good life and perhaps become a client of HOPE one day as well.

loans.use: to pay for bread, butter, chocolate spread, peanut butter, and sausage

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud, age 55, is a grocer. He and his wife have one child. He is the only provider for the family. 

Mahmoud owns a small grocery store that sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2006. He has built up good experience in this field and is well-known in his local area. He has an excellent reputation.

Mahmoud is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $2,400 in order to renovate his grocery store and to purchase a motor generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and to purchase a motor generator

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y amable. Convive con james quien es empleado y padre de sus 4 hijos, Billy, James, Johnny y Patrick de 12, 10, 7 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan la casa de su hermana, cuentan con terreno propio pero no lo habitan por lo lejos que se encuentra. 
La actividad que realiza Jesús es la venta de comida como tallarines, estofados, juanes  y refrescos por las mañanas en un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, donde atiende cordialmente a sus clientes quienes la visitan a diario por la buena sazón en sus preparaciones.
Se inició hace más de 1 año, con un pequeño capital propio y gracias al apoyo de su hermano a logrado establecerse. Considera su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y le ha servido para salir de muchos apuros, además de lo que prepara siempre queda algo para su familia, asi evita gastos de aliemnto en su hogar. 
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingreso y no depender únicamente de su pareja, más bien apoyarlo con los gastos y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ahora está ahorrando,  pues desea en un futuro abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, para así estar más cerca de sus hijos durante el día. Éste será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida y contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para realizar sus planes. Por eso se compromete a  cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además está a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que se brindan mutuamente.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros. Buscará precios bajos, así tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús, 34 years old, is a friendly working woman. She lives with James who is an employee and father of her four children, Billy, James, Johnny and Patrick who are 12, 10, 7 and 2 years of age respectively. They live in her sister’s house. They have their own property but they don’t live there as it is so far away.

Jesús sells food such as noodles, stews, juanes (a Peruvian dish with chicken, rice, spices, beaten eggs and hard boiled eggs, bundled tightly in banana leaves and then placed in a pot to cook) and beverages in the morning at a stand in the city marketplace, where she cordially attends to her customers who visit her daily because of her tasty preparations.

She began this a little more than a year ago, with a little bit of her own capital and thanks to the support of her brother she successfully established herself. She considers her business profitable because the earnings have helped her through many predicaments, and besides that she is always preparing something for her family, and so avoids food household expenses. 

She started her business with the desire of having her own earnings and not to depend only on her partner, but to support him with the expenses and to bring a better quality of life to her family. Now she is saving because in the future she wants to open a grocery store at home, in order to be closer to her children during the day. This will be her fourth loan through MFP. She is grateful and happy knowing she has financial support to reach her plans, and she agrees to comply with the payment plan as she did with her previous loans. She also likes the communal bank because of the support they give each other.

With the amount requested of 1000 soles, she will buy the necessary ingredients in order to make her dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, and more. She will search for low prices in order to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and more

loans.name: Maranatha 2 Group

texts.en:
Bienvenue, age 50, is married and has two children, 17 and 25 years old. The 17-year-old is still in school, and the older child is working. Bienvenue is representing the Maranatha 2 Group. She sells children and baby's clothes in a local market. She has had this business for 20 years. She has gained a good reputation in the community, and many people know about her business. She will use the loan proceeds to buy more clothing to sell. Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service to all her clients.
Bienvenue has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to grow her business and become a great businesswoman. She hopes her children work in commerce, as she does.

loans.use: to pay for baby and children's clothes to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Le Tresor 1 Group

texts.en:
Blaise is 45 years old and divorced. He has two children, ages 7 and 28, and his youngest child is currently attending school. For the past seven years, Blaise has operated a small chicken farm, raising chickens and selling eggs to vendors around Brazzaville. His business strategy is to deliver the eggs to his vendors, instead of having them come to him. Blaise also delivers eggs directly to the houses of certain clients. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. 

Blaise is requesting a loan as a representative of the Le Tresor 1 group. He will use his portion of the loan to buy chicken feed. Currently, he keeps his chickens near his house on a piece of land in the city. In the future, Blaise wants to move his farm to a new location a little outside of Brazzaville and be able to buy the land, build a house for his family, and have a larger chicken farm.

loans.use: to pay for chicken feed

loans.name: Redempteur 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
David, age 52, is married and has three children, ages 13 to 33. Two of his children currently attend school. David is representing the Redempteur 2 (1) group. He owns and operates a restaurant. He has had this business for nine years. He will use the loan proceeds to buy drinks and a freezer for his restaurant. His business strategy is to keep his restaurant clean, up-to-date, and organized. He wants to give his customers a good dining experience. 
David has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Currently, he is renting the restaurant space, but in the future he hopes to own his own place. He wants his children to succeed in life. He is thrilled that his second child is attending college.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and a freezer for his restaurant.

loans.name: Karrar

texts.en:
Karrar is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 21 years old, single, and lives with five family members, of whom three are employed.
Karrar is a carpenter and specializes in making all types of furniture. He established his business in 2003. He has built up good experience in this field, and he is being well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.
He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to buy a specialized machine for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine for his work, making furniture.

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 Group

texts.en:
Berthe, age 48, is a member of La Bienfaisance 2 group. She sells wood, charcoal, salted fish, and other products at her local market. She has been a vendor in the market for 15 years. She has gained a good reputation over the years. 

Berthe and her husband have raised three children, now between the ages of 27 and 32. She also cares and provides for two nephews.

She will use the loan funds to buy oil, flour, salted fish, rice, and charcoal. She also plans to travel to Pointe Noire, a city on the coast, to buy merchandise because fish and other products are cheaper there. Her business strategy is to sell popular items that her customers want.

Berthe has received three previous loans from Kiva partner HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to buy a piece of land for her family and eventually a car.

loans.use: to buy wood, charcoal, salted fish, oil, rice, and flour

loans.name: Dieu Merci 2 Group

texts.en:
Elisabeth, age 51, is single with three children, ages 17 to 31 years old. The youngest is currently attending school. Elizabeth is representing the Dieu Merci 2 group. 

Elisabeth has a small restaurant and has been operating it for 27 years! She has gained many loyal customers in the community over the years because of her great food. She will use the loan to buy a freezer to keep her food in. Her business strategy is friendly customer service and to have everything clean and presentable in her restaurant. 

Elisabeth has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to buy a parcel of land and build a house for her family one day.

loans.use: to pay for a freezer.

loans.name: Yetana Group

texts.en:
Yetana is a group of 13 farmers in Bungoma District represented by Pamela. The group has 9 women and 4 men. Pamela is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Pamela is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and use increased profits to send her children to school.

Pamela described her harvest last year as poor. She hopes as a One Acre Fund farmer she will be able to join the ranks of One Acre Fund farmers that have doubled their harvest in their first year of the program. She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Pamela's group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 1 Group

texts.en:
Xavier, age 40, is single and has three children, 9 to 16 years old. All three of his children are attending school. He is representing the La Bienfaisance 1 group. Xavier has a small grocery boutique where he sells a variety of food products. He will use the loan proceeds to buy sugar, oil, rice, salt and tomatoes. His business strategy is to be very nice to the customers and to offer friendly and helpful service. 
Xavier has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. Xavier wants to continue to grow his business and build a large space for his store. He wants all of his children to go to school and be well educated.

loans.use: to pay for sugar, oil, rice, salt and tomatoes for his grocery boutique.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. Hussain is the only provider of the family.

Hussain is a retailer. He specializes in selling doors and windows. He established his business in 2006. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Ada, age 32, is single with two children, ages 4 and 8, and a baby on the way! He has one child currently attending school. He is representing the La Bienfaisance 2 (2) group. Ada owns and operates a restaurant in his local community. He has had this restaurant for one year. He plans to use the loan to buy drinks, plates, and more silverware for his restaurant. His business strategy is to offer great customer service. When his customers arrive he serves them quickly and makes sure that they are satisfied with their meal. 

This is Ada's first loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and his group are confident he will repay the loan. Ada hopes to modernize and continue to develop his restaurant as it grows. He wants his children to succeed in life and work in some kind of business.

loans.use: to pay for drinks, plates, and silverware.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has an only child. Raed is the only provider of the family. 

Raed owns a small shop and specializes in selling men's shoes and accessories. After working with his father for a long time in the same shop, he decided to take over the business and continue in this path. He established his business in 2007. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Raed is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Le Tresor 2 Group

texts.en:
Ida is 50 years old and single with a 29-year-old child. For the past 10 years, she has sold clothing in a local market. Ida has gained valuable customers and her business strategy is to offer friendly and polite customer service. In Congo, used-clothing vendors buy large bales of clothing from a company that receives clothing from various places around the world. Ida sorts the clothes to sell. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo.

Ida is requesting a loan as a representative of the Le Tresor 2 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy a large bale of used clothing. Ida wants to continue to improve her business and she hopes her child will be happy in life and find a job.

loans.use: to pay for a bale of used clothing

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie is 53 and single with four children, ages 18 to 33 years old. Her youngest is currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Marie has sold a variety of products at a stand at the market. Her business strategy is to allow loyal and trustworthy customers to buy her merchandise on credit. This helps attracts new customers and keep older customers coming back to her business. Marie has successfully repaid five previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo.

Marie is requesting a loan as a representative of the Jehovah Jireh 2 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy food products, such as oil, rice, and sugar, as well as hair styling products. In the future, Marie hopes to be able to have a large grocery store one day in its own building.

loans.use: to pay for food items and hair stying products

loans.name: La Bienfaisance 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Seth, age 56, is married with 3 children, aged 14 to 30 years old. All 3 of his children are currently attending high school or college. 

He is representing the La Bienfaisance 2 (1) group. Seth has a small grocery market and has been operating it for over 20 years. He has gained valuable experience over the years, as well as many loyal customers. He will use the loan to buy oil, sugar, tomatoes, rice, and kerosene to sell in his store. His business strategy is to always have in stock what the customers want. He regularly asks his customers what items they prefer and tries to cater to their needs. 

Seth has received 3 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue to progress and open another business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for oil, sugar, tomatoes, rice, and kerosene to sell at his market

loans.name: Jehovah Jireh 1 Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 49 and single with two children, ages 22 and 25 years old. Her children are both finished with high school and currently attending university. For the past 10 years, Francoise has sold various merchandise at a stand in a local market. She has successfully repaid five previous loans with the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. Her business strategy is to give a good price relative to the other prices around her in the market.

Francoise is requesting a loan as a representative of the Jehovah Jireh 1 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy plastic products, plates, other kitchen items, and clothes. In the future, Francoise hopes to become a great businesswoman. She also hopes both of her children will finish their college studies.

loans.use: to pay for plastic products, kitchenware, and clothes

loans.name: Dieu Merci 1 Group

texts.en:
Virginie is 45 and single with two children, ages 18 and 19 years old. Both of her children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Virginie has sold a variety of food products at a stand at the local market.  Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service and give a small "cadeau," or gift, to returning customers. Virginie has successfully repaid five previous loans from the Kiva partner HOPE Congo. 

Virginie is requesting a loan as a representative of the Dieu Merci 1 group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy foufou, bread, and canned goods to sell. Foufou is a white cornmeal-like food that is a staple in this region of the world.  Virginie would like to continue to expand and open a second business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for foufou, bread, and canned goods

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two sons who are still going to school. She has been a food vendor for 12 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Merina's eleventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a radio, TV set, mattress, bed, cupboard, and sofa set. She also used the loans to pay for school fees and cover household expenses; she has paid back all her loans successfully. She is expending a loan to buy more food to resell and to pay for school fees. She has a dream of owning a hotel.

Merina will share this loan with her loan group, "Momela", which has eleven members. These members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food to resell and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 65 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Andrés su esposo desde hace 45 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia, que adquirió hace 34 años.
Ella vive en compañía de sus hijos, pues tiene una casa muy amplia donde cada uno vive independientemente y así no se siente sola con su esposo. Su actividad principal es su tienda de comestibles que abrió desde hace 21 años, en todo este tiempo lo surtió muy bien tanto así que cuenta con clientes fijos. También cuenta con 4 vacas, un toro, gallinas y cuyes, los cuales vende o consume de acuerdo a su necesidad. Como nunca descansa por temporadas siembra maíz y cebada, pero la alfalfa lo realiza constantemente para el alimento de sus animales. Estas siembras lo venden a un comerciante mayorista que la visita muy seguido ya que conoce de la calidad de sus tierras, que descansan un año para volver a producir el alimento. Ahora desea mejorar su tienda de comestibles, pues sabe que no tendrá la misma fuerza cuando envejezca más y solo tendrá que dedicarse a su negocio para subsistir. 
Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los emprendedores” y este es el crédito número 19  con MFP, por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, pues lleva muchos años de conocerlos.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar por sacos.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and a wise woman.  She lives with Andres, her husband of 45 years.  Together they have eight children, but they only live with two of them in their own house, which they bought 34 years ago.  She lives with her children, but they have a large house where everyone can live independently, and therefore she doesn't feel alone with her husband.  

She works at her grocery store, which she opened 21 years ago.  In all of this time, she has stocked it very well and has counted on loyal customers.  She also has four cows, a bull, chickens, and guinea pigs, which she sells or eats, depending on their needs.  Since she never rests, she seasonally plants corn and barley and grows alfalfa all year long to feed her animals.  She sells the crops to a wholesale buyer who visits often because he knows the quality of her land, which rests for a year before growing feed again.  

Now she wants to improve her grocery store, since she knows that she will not have the same energy as she gets older and will need to dedicate herself to her store to make a living.  She is a member of the community bank Los Emprendedores.  This is their 19th loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support, which will allow her to meet her objectives. She promises to make her payments on time.  She is happy to be a part of her community bank because she has known them for many years.  Maria will use the requested loan to purchase staple products such as sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase staple items such as sacks of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene la edad de 41 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y los tres hijos actualmente. El quiere compra almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. El cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como un caficultor de la zona. El pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three children.  He would like to purchase copperwood trees to replant his coffee fields and also some supplies.  He has land and he wants to replant the most damaged areas to increase their next harvest and grow as a coffee producer in his area.  He hopes these improvements will generate a larger coffee production and also earn him more income to continue with his project and improve his well-being.  

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best facilities and low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase copperwood trees and supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is from Tirebe in Mombasa, Kenya's coastal region. She is 31 years of age and married wth three children, two of whom are still in school. 

She is the owner of a shop where she has been working for two years. She says that she's making headway with the business because she has been able to attract a good number of customers due to the fact that she always has a very well-stocked shop. She is a very enthusiastic person who wants to keep growing and investing in her business so that she can help with the household expenses.

Fatuma is asking for a loan amounting to KSH 30,000 to expand her business and invest in drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables, and other products. This way, she can continue to provide her customers with a good variety of products and also attract new customers. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing items to sell in her shop

loans.name: Zid

texts.en:
Zid is 28 years old and married with two children. He is a youth client from Iraq and is the only provider for his family. In 2003, Zid established a small shop where he sells fruits and vegetables. He now has an employee and has gained good experience in this field. Zid is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Zid is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan to pay the yearly rent for his shop. In the future, his goal is to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to pay a year's rent for his shop

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César, de 35 años es un hombre trabajador. Junto a Julia, su esposa desde hace 10 años; cuidan de sus 3 hijos en la casa que compró hace 9 años.  
“Me falta muchos objetivos por cumplir”, afirma. Aún no posee el dinero necesario para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, pero eso no lo desanima al contrario. Trabaja cada día con más esfuerzo, ahorrando lo que pueda para comprar uno. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, olluco, oca, mashua, cebada, habas y alverja. Cuenta que alquila terrenos de su comunidad, porque cuestan menos y de esa manera apoya en el crecimiento de sus pobladores. En cada cosecha aprovecha sus viajes a la capital para vender sus alimentos. Viaja 2 veces a la semana, llevando maca, alverja y papa; los cuales vende al menudeo en el mercado “la parada”, que es la más grande del país. Como es un hombre de campo, cuenta que posee 3 caballos y 3 burros los cuales utiliza como animales de carga para trasportar los fertilizantes hacia sus sembríos. “de esa manera me canso menos”, comenta.
Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y está contento de saber, que tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su trabajo Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
César; invertirá el dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa de la variedades “yungay, canchan, andina y huairo macho”.
texts.en:
Cesar is 35 years old and a hard-working man. Together with Julia, his wife of 10 years, he takes care of their 3 children in the house he bought nine years ago.
  
“I still have a lot of goals to achieve," says Cesar. He still does not have the money he needs to buy his own land for agriculture, but this hasn't discouraged him at all. To the contrary, he works harder every day, saving what he can to buy land in the future. 

He now has seven years of experience growing potato, ulluco, New Zealand yam, mashua, barley, broad beans, and peas. He rents land from his community because it costs less and in that way he can help support the growth of the community. After each harvest, he travels into the capital to sell his vegetables. He travels twice a week, taking mashua, peas, and potatoes, which he sells at retail in the "La Parada" market, the largest in the country. Because he is a framer, he also has three horses and three donkeys, which he uses as loading animals to transport fertilizers to the fields. "That way I am less tired," he says. 

This will be his sixth loan with MFP and he is happy to know he will have financial support because he is confident that he will progress with his work. He also promises to make his payments on time. He is thankful to be a part of his association because all of its members are responsible people and very supportive. Cesar will invest the money in buying natural fertilizers to spread over the various varieties of potato he grows, including yungay, canchan, andina, and huairo macho.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Gevork

texts.en: Gevork is 38 years old. He lives in the small village of Akhaltsikhe district with his wife and 2 children, who go to school. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides that, Gevork owns a plot of land, where maize, haricot, and potatoes are grown. They sell the harvested products and cheese locally. Gevork is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. He requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow, they will produce and sell more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Gevork awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 31 years old and married. She is from the village of Vedreba, in the Kareli district where she lives with her family: her husband, three children, parents-in-law, and a retired grandmother. Natia’s husband and father-in-law are truck drivers who transport sand and also wood from the forest to sell to villagers. Together, Natia’s family manages the agricultural land that they own. They grow garlic and apple and sell the harvested products at the local open market.

Natia is requesting a loan to change the tires and motor oil on their truck. The old tires are in bad condition and are dangerous for her husband and father-in-law. Her loan will allow Natia’s husband to continue his job safely and a earn monthly income. In the future, the family will work to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to change tires and motor oil of her truck

loans.name: Muyayi Central Group

texts.en:
Robai is a member of Muyayi central Group in Bungoma South District. She is pictured with 14 One Acre Fund farmers, eight women and six men. Robai is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Robai first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2005 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Robai joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices of fertilizer and hybrid seeds as well as learn more about proper farming.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Robai was only able to harvest ½ bags of maize per 1 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 10 bags per ½ acre! She plans on using future profits from the harvest to save for the future and send her children to school. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Robai's group will receive seven acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Waukae Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in his early 30s, is married with one daughter who is still small. He has been selling airtime and recharging telephones since 2007.  He works from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to cover household expenses and to put his shop in good order by adding more shelves. He also sells some food, like vitumbuwa, mandazi, small cakes, sweets, biscuits, water, and juice, and has paid back all his loans successfully. He asks for another loan to increase his business products.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "WAUKAE", with 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on his business products

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 49 years old and married with two children. He is the only provider for his family. Since 2011, Ahmad has operated a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. Ahmad has an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to pay the yearly rent of his grocery store. In the future, he plans to increase his business and his profits to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay a year's rent for his grocery store

loans.name: Fronterizas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FRONTERIZAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carolina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de toallas, restaurante de comida, hilado y trenzado de mantas, venta de calcetines, venta de comida, venta de artículos varios.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carolina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de las compañeras de su grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pensión); cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió de hace cinco años con el apoyo de sus padres.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mesas, sillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Fronterizas community bank will start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional community center.  The group has six members and is led by a board where Carolina is the president.  The businesses the members have are varied, including: towel sales, a restaurant, knitted and braided blankets, sock sales, food sales, and sale of various items.  

This loan will benefit small businesswomen like Carolina.  She said that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years.  She joined this group by invitation of her friends who were members of the institution.  She has a business selling food (making set meals each day).  She started the business five years ago with the support of her parents.

Carolina will use this loan to purchase tables and chairs.  She will purchase them at the market in the city of El Alto and later will put them in her sales area.  This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family, since she is single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the meetings and being able to save.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Flor De Haba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE HABA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Natty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de ropa de bebe, artesanía en muñequería para exportar, venta de cuadernos empastados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Natty es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de bebe; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada que comercializaba estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de frazadas de bebe) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.

En la fotografía acompaña la hija de la señora Genara, quien esta vestida de rosado.
texts.en:
The group “Flor de Haba” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center. It has six members and is managed by a board of directors of which Natty is President. The members of the group are involved in various businesses, which include: knitting baby clothes, handmade dolls for export, and the sale of bound notebooks.

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro-entrepreneurs of which Natty is a member. She says that this is her first time with Pro Mujer, joining after a friend who is a member of the institution invited her. Currently, she has a business selling baby clothes. She learned the business from a sister-in-law who also sells the products. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (by buying baby blankets) that she will buy from distributor companies and later sell at the markets in El Alto city. This work allows her to generate income to support her family as much as she can, as she is married and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she enjoys the health education they provide.

In the photograph, she is joined by the daughter of Mrs. Genara who is dressed in pink.

loans.use: Buy baby blankets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for their livestock and dairy business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred used the previous loan to buy rice and sugar to sell. He is a twenty-five-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent home.

He has been operating a retail shop for four years now. Alfred started with capital of 2,500,000 only and now his business is worth 6,000,000. The major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming and a hardware shop.

Alfred intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets and cement for resale.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets and cement for resale.

loans.name: Ramona
