When the harvest is finished, she sells part of the crops and reserves some for personal consumption in her home.  She is very enterprising and admirable and to her the most important thing in life is to earn her daily bread in a dignified manner, with her own hands.  She has worked as a farmer all her life and this is how she has managed to survive because she doesn’t have another source of income.

As an entrepreneurial and visionary woman she has decided to approach this institution, now that the planting season is approaching and she wants to be prepared.  She is asking INTEGRAL for a loan so she can buy seeds, insecticides, compost, and other things so she can start planting as soon as possible and be able to harvest the fruits of her labor.  She is confident that she will have an abundant harvest which will allow her to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farmins supplies.

loans.name: Benito Juarez Group

texts.es:
La señora Agustina  es otro de los integrantes del grupo Benito Juarez tiene la edad de 78 años, es viuda y   solo estudio la primaria y que cuando era pequeña los padres tenían otra manera de pensar y solo estudiaban los hombres y las mujeres se quedaban en casa a aprender a realizar trabajos del hogar.

Doña Agustina siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora pero fue hasta hace 5 años que ella decidió iniciar a vender ropa y cosméticos de manera ambulante (casa por casa) con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad ella va mostrando sus productos y en algunas otras ocasiones levanta pedidos, en estos años ella ha hecho muchos clientes y su negocio a progresado.

El desafío que enfrenta  es cuando el ingenio azucarero de la región donde vive inicia la producción ya que sus ventas disminuyen pero dijo que no se desanima solo hay que caminar mas y todo se vende.

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de blusas, faldas, pantalones,  camisas, ropa interior, calcetines, cosméticos y perfumería para continuar con sus ventas.

Doña agustina quiere que su negocio crezca  más y tener más clientes para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y algún día poner un negocio fijo.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Ceferina venta de ropa, Jazmin venta de abarrotes, Maria Dora venta de cosméticos, Candido cría de cerdos, Lucina venta de ropa, Esperanza venta de refrescos y dulces.

Nota: la señora de pantalon de mezclilla y blusa blanca  es una vecina que quiso participar en la foto.
texts.en:
Augustina is another member of the Benito Juarez group.  She is 78 years old, a widow, and has an elementary school education.  When he was young her parent had a different way of thinking and only the boys went to school.  The girls stayed home to learn the household tasks.  Augustina has always been an enterprising woman and five years ago she decided to sell clothing and cosmetics on foot (door to door) with her friends and neighbors.  She shows her products and takes orders.  She had earned many customers in recent years and her business is moving ahead.

Augustina wants to grow her business and have more customers.

The other members are Ceferina, who sells clothimg. Jasmine sells groceries.  The woman in the denim pants and white blouse is a neighbor who wanted to be in the photo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: El Moralito Group

texts.es: Oliva tiene 50 años de edad es originaria de una comunidad llamada Coatepec. Desde hace varios años ella pertenece a un grupo llamado La Cabañita y que gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido por parte de la financiera ha mejorado su negocio de panadería, dice que a diario hace pan y que mas que nada ella reparte en diferentes tiendas de su población y que compra los insumos en una tienda donde le dan precios económicos, lo que mas hace son las conchas, bolillos, teleras, muelas, flores, cuernitos y muchos otros panes y de los mas que le compran son de nata, de huevo y de mantequilla "aunque sean un poco mas caritos" como ella dice. Está pidiendo un crédito a VisionFund para comprar insumos para elaborar el pan como leche, huevo, natas, mantequilla, harina, saborizantes, y muchos productos que ocupa. Dice que el crédito le servirá de mucho porque tendrá mas material para elaborar su riquísimo pan que hace. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, Maria Felicitas, Ana Laura, María Virginia, Ana Lilia, Beatriz, Pablo y María Elena, ellos invertirán sus crédito en sus negocios como invertir en cosméticos por catalogo para después venderlos, en ropa para dama, caballeros para vender, compra de zapatos por catalogo para después venderlos.
texts.en: Olivia is 50 years old and from the community called Coatepec.  She has been a member of the La Cabañita group for several years and her bakery business has improved because of the loans she’s gotten.  She says that she makes bread every day and delivers it to different stores in her community.  She buys her supplies in a store where the prices are lower and she makes many kinds breads of various types. She says that this loan will be very helpful because she will have more supplies to bake the delicious bread.  The other members are Juana Guadalupe, Rosa Isela, Maria Felicitas, Ana Laura, María Virginia, Ana Lilia, Beatriz, Pablo and María Elena.  They will use the money to buy cosmetics, clothing, and shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: A Sandra le ha ido muy bien con su distribución de productos avícolas y se lo debe a su anterior credikiva, con el cual ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ello sus posibilidades de compra, pues logró invertir en un bulto de pollo y otro de pechuga específicamente. Su clientela potencial ha virado su mirada hacia su negocio y esto hace que   crezca, por eso entusiasmada con su trabajo está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará   productos avícolas en mayor volumen que su anterior inversión, ya que planea abrir nuevos merados y debe estar provisionada, pues se acerca la época de carnavales, en la cual las inversiones en sus productos se ve reflejada en mas ventas, porque Carnavales y sus fiestas, ayudan mucho al consumo de alimentos y lo mejor que en medio de ellas, las comidas están elaboradas con pollo y pechuga y benefician su ingreso haciendo que su credikiva, sea todo un éxito
texts.en: Sandra’s poultry products business has gone well thanks to her previous Kiva loan.  She was able to buy chicken breasts.  Her potential customers have been varied and this has allowed her to grow her business.  She is excited about her work and is requesting a new Kiva loan which she will use to buy products in quantity like with her last loan.  She plans to open other markets and wants to be prepared.  The carnival season is approaching and increased inventory means more sales because consumption increases during carnival and much of the food is made with chicken breasts.  Her Kiva loans have been a success.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es: Doña Emma tiene 39 años de edad y es originaria de una comunidad rica en historia ya que se encuentra la zona arqueológica de Zirahuato el cual es visitado por muchos turistas del país y a nivel mundial. Dona Emma es parte de un grupo llamado Las Peras, ella tiene una cooperativa escolar en una primaria de su localidad, en la cual vende refrescos, jugos de diferentes sabores, sabritas, sopas instantáneas, y también hace antojitos mexicanos como tacos dorados, enchiladas, pambazos para darles a los niños de la escuela. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer las comidas que vende, como frutos y legumbres, masa, bolillos, dulces de diferentes sabores, refrescos, jugos y muchas cosas más. Dice que desde un día antes va a comprar todo lo que necesita, porque desde muy temprana hora empieza hacer las comidas ya que los niños salen a receso a las 9.30 de la mañana y tiene que estar todo preparado. Dice que a ella le gustaría tener un local ya establecido para no estar de un lado a otro. Las demás compañeras del grupo se llaman Maria Veronica, Maria Angelica, Graciela y Adelina ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para elaborar tortillas a mano para su venta, compra y venta de ganado y en la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en: Emma is 49 years old and from a Community in the Zirahuato architectural zone, rich in history and visited by national and international tourists.  Emma is a member of the Las Peras group.  She has a stand in a local school where she sells soft drinks, juices, chips, instant soups, and also Mexican food such as fried tacos, enchiladas, and pambazos to give the school children.  She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as fruits, vegetables, dough and other things.  She says that she bought what she needed a few days ago because she starts cooking very early, because the children have recess at 9:30 am and she has to have everything ready.  She would like to have a local establishment so she doesn’t have to go back and forth.  The other members are Maria Veronica, Maria Angelica, Graciela and Adelina.  They buy and sell livestock, and seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: María Eduviges

texts.es: María Eduviges, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada, vive con sus hijos y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras  cuando inicien las  lluvias y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también  seguir invirtiendo más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Eduviges is 52 years old, married and lives with her children and husband who are her greatest priority.  She will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and pay for labor to help work the coffee crops.  She also wants to buy some seedlings to increase her density when the rains begin so she can take advantage of the fertile soil, climate and other things that favor raising coffee.  She expects to improve her family’s living conditions and also invest more in her crops and complete some other goals.  This will be her first loan through FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans through state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with ease and at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 22 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a married man and has one child. He has been running a gas cylinders shop. His customers are mostly his neighbors who are looking for the affordable prices he offers. He started his business with a small amount of capital buying a few gas cylinders that allowed him to expand his business. Recently, he couldn't restock more for his business due to the lack of money, which is why he is asking for a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy gas cylinders to use for his business. He would like to earn more profits and to continue improving his business and pleasing his customers.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders to use for his business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.es: Michael, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está casa,  vive con su hijo y esposo, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de materiales para realizar el trabajo de fotocopiado que es indispensable para dar un buen servicio a los clientes, espera tener la posibilidad de adquirir materiales de buena calidad y así los usuarios tendrán un trabajo deseado y en forma rápida, y contará con lo necesario para realizarlo. Además de aprovechar los años de experiencia que tiene y seguir manteniendo la clientela actual y seguir aumentándola como también los servicios e ir incorporando nuevos. El local se encuentra en una zona de alto comercialización y no tiene competencia en el mismo desempeño. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Michael, 30, is married and lives with his child and wife, who are his main priority.

With his loan he plans to buy materials for his photocopying work that are indispensable for giving his customers good service.  He hopes to be able to acquire good-quality materials so he has everything he needs to give the users the work they want quickly.  Also, he'll make the most of his years of experience, continue with his current customers, and increase his clientele and his services, as well as keep adding new ones.

His store is located in a highly commercial area  and there's no competition in the same line of work.  It's the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy materials for his photocopying service

loans.name: La Semillita Group

texts.es: Edith tiene 25 años de edad es soltera y vive con su mama, ella es parte de un grupo llamado La Semillita, dice que se animo a pedir un crédito por que quiere hacer crecer su negocio, ella estudio la carrera de cultora de belleza dice que siempre le agrado la cuestión de peinar, arreglar a las personas y decidió estudiar una corta carrera de estilismo es por eso que ella está pidiendo un crédito a VisionFund para la compra de los materiales que ocupa, dice que mas o menos le va bien que ahorita esta agarrando mas practica aunque no tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene 3 años en el negocio pero hay gente que le tiene mucha fe ella dice "hay señoras que me dicen que tengo buena mano para cortar el pelo que por que les crece muy rápido y eso hace que tenga mas fama" y ríe. Ella dice que comprara tintes, unas tijeras de buena calidad, peróxidos, tubos, y una plancha para alaciar el cabello de las clientas. Platica que tiene en negocio en su casa pero que a ella le encantaría tener una estética con todos sus muebles que ocupa para dar un servicio de calidad a la clientela. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman María Balbina, Yolanda, Elodia, Rosa, María Isabel, María Santos, José David, María Guadalupe, Diana y María Eufemia ellas invertirán en sus negocios en una tienda de ropa, en la compra de pollos para cría y venderlos, en frutas y legumbres para su venta, en una cocina económica, compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, en accesorios para celular que vende, en tienda de abarrotes, en joyería de fantasía que vende y para la compra y venta de guajolotes.
texts.en:
Edith, 25, is single and lives with her mother. She is a member of a group called La Semillita. She says that she was motivated to apply for a loan in order to grow her business. She studied to be a beautician. She says that she always enjoyed styling and dressing people, so she decided to study a short degree in styling. 

She is applying for a loan from VisionFund to buy the materials which she uses. She says that her business is going quite well and that she is getting more practice now. She does not have much experience and she has been in this business for 3 years, but there are people who have plenty of faith in her. She laughs, "There are women who tell me I have a good hand for haircuts because their hair grows very quickly, and that makes me more famous." She will buy dye, good-quality scissors, peroxide, tubes, and an iron to straighten her clients' hair. She says that she runs her business in her home, but she would love to have a salon with furniture in order to give her clientele a good-quality service. 

The other members of the group are María Balbina, Yolanda, Elodia, Rosa, María Isabel, María Santos, José David, María Guadalupe, Diana, and María Eufemia. They will invest in their businesses, such as a clothing store, raising chickens for sale, a home-style restaurant, selling shoes from a catalog, a grocery store, and the sale of fruits and vegetables, mobile phone accessories, fantasy jewelry, and turkeys.

loans.use: to buy dye, good-quality scissors, peroxide, tubes, and an iron to straighten clients' hair.

loans.name: Los Inversionistas Group

texts.es: Doña Clara, o Clarita como le llaman, es una mujer agradable pero a la vez introvertida, ella tiene 44 años de edad ella es parte de un grupo llamado Los Inversionistas, ella tiene varios ciclos en este grupo y es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora ella tiene un puesto de dulces afuera de una escuela primaria donde a diario saca desde las 7.30 de la mañana, también vende ropa de invierno que ella hace como son sweaters, bufandas, guantes, gorros, pantuflas tejidas con gancho y con agujas. Platica que dependiendo de la temporada vende su ropa que cuando es temporada de calor vende gorras, playeras, sandalias, sombreros de palma. Unos los compra en la Ciudad de México y otras cosas ella las elabora. Ella tiene una niña la cual estudia la primaria y esta muy orgullosa de ella porque es una niña de buen promedio. Platica que esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere surtirse de material para hacer sus costuras y por que por las tardes vende pan en una de las calles mas concurridas de su población llamada “calle del hambre” debido a que todo el día se vende comida desde las seis de la mañana ya están abriendo los puestecitos hasta la una de la mañana. Uno de los sueños de Clarita como le dicen muy cariñosamente es tener un puesto un poco mas amplio ya que no le caben las cosas que vende y tiene que sacar de poquito. Las demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, José Antonio, María del Carmen, Eva, Maricela, Marcelino, Lucila y Esmeralda ellos invertirán en sus negocios como son en un taller mecánico, en compra y venta de zapatos por catalogo, compra venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, en material para bordados artesanales, insumos para hacer postres y venderlos, en la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada y en ropa interior para dama para vender.
texts.en:
Clara, or Clarita, as she is called, is a friendly yet introverted woman. She is 44 years old and is a member of the Los Inversionistas ("The Investors") group. She has been in this group for many years and is a very responsible and hardworking woman. She has a sweets stand outside a primary school, where she works from 7:30 in the morning. She also sells winter clothing which she makes herself, such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, hats, and slippers sewn using a hook and needle. 

She says that she sells clothing depending on the season. When it is hot outside, she sells caps, T-shirts, sandals, and straw hats. She buys some of her merchandise in Mexico City and she makes some herself. She has one daughter, who is studying in primary school. She is very proud of her daughter because she is an above average girl. 

She has applied for a loan because she would like to stock her business with sewing materials. In the afternoons, she also sells bread on one of the busiest streets in her town, which is called the "calle de hambre" ("street of hunger") because vendors sell food from their stalls all day long, from six in the morning until one in the morning. 

One of Clarita's dreams is to have a larger stall, because she cannot fit in everything that she sells and she has to take some things out. The other members of the group are Mariana, Eva de los Milagros, José Antonio, María del Carmen, Eva, Maricela, Marcelino, Lucila, and Esmeralda. They will invest in their businesses, such as a mechanic shop, shoe sales from a catalog, materials for artisan embroidery, supplies to make and sell desserts, the purchase of in-season fruit and vegetables, and the sale of clothing, cosmetics, and women's undergarments.

loans.use: to buy materials to make seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Amigos Group

texts.es: Doña Clara tiene 55 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, dice que ella es parte  de un grupo nuevo llamado Amigos ya que anteriormente estaban en otro grupo pero por problemas personales decidieron dividirse y hacer otro grupo y llamarlo así porque se apoyan mutuamente. Doña Clarita, como le dicen todos, se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como vestidos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, pants etc. Dice que ella surte su mercancía en la ciudad de México por que allá le dan bajos precios de lo que ocupa de material, también hace uniformes a varias escuelas de su población. Ahorita ella pide un crédito para la compra de material ya que quiere surtirse por que en el mes de marzo le mandan hacer la vestimenta de las caracterizaciones del Viacrucis de su colonia y tiene que tener material para hacer los vestuarios que año con año hace con mucho esmero para la semana santa. Dice que comprara tela de diferentes texturas y colores, hilos, cierres, botones, listones etc. También hace composturas a la ropa, pone cierres, botones hace dobladillos y muchas cosas más. Las otras integrantes de su grupo son María Eugenia, Nancy, Silvia, Yessica, María de los Ángeles, Lorena, Graciela y Rodolfo los cuales invertirán sus créditos en una tienda de ropa, en frutas y legumbres para su venta, en una zapatería, en un club nutricional.
texts.en:
Clara, 55, is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is a member of the "Amigos" ("Friends") group. She had previously been part of another group, but due to personal problems they decided to divide up and create another group. They chose the name "Amigos" because they support each other.

Clarita, as everyone calls her, makes a living making clothing such as dresses, blouses, shirts, trousers, sweatpants, etc. She buys her goods in Mexico City, because they give her low prices there for the materials she needs. She also makes uniforms for various schools in her town. 

She is applying for a loan to buy materials to stock her business, because in the month of March she will have an order for the wardrobe for the portrayal of the Via Crucis ("Way of the Cross") in her town. She needs material to make the costumes, which she painstakingly sews year after year for the Holy Week. 

She says that she will buy fabric in different textures and colors, thread, zippers, buttons, ribbon, etc. She also makes clothing repairs, adds zippers and buttons, and hems clothing, among many other services. 

The other members of the group are María Eugenia, Nancy, Silvia, Yessica, María de los Ángeles, Lorena, Graciela, and Rodolfo. They will invest in their businesses, such as a clothing store, the sale of fruit and vegetables, a shoe store, and a nutritional club.

loans.use: to buy fabric in different textures and colors, thread, zippers, buttons, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: Dalias Group

texts.es: Leopoldo es un hombre trabajador, cumplido en sus pagos, dice que él anteriormente estaba en un grupo pero desgraciadamente falleció uno de sus integrantes y se desintegro ese grupo y decidió meterse al que pertenece su vecina que sabe el que es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Platica que se dedica a la compra venta de ropa y calzado de segunda mano. Dice que todo empezó por que el estuvo en Estado Unidos trabajando y le mandaba ropa a su esposa para que la vendieran y como vio que era muy buen negocio decidió regresarse para estar a lado de su familia y así juntos hacer mas productivo el negocio, dice Leopoldo “mientras mi señora saca el puesto en la puerta de la casa yo me voy a vender a los tianguis de la región en mi carro y a veces me voy en mi carrito a vender por los ranchos y si se vende muy bien ya que traigo ropa de calidad y a bajo precio”. El surte la ropa en una población llamada Hidalgo Michoacán, donde le venden las pacas (mayoreao) de ropa de diferentes tallas, colores y para todos los gustos, platica que está pidiendo un crédito por que quiere volver a surtir porque ahorita viene otra temporada y quiere surtir otra ropa para el calor. Su propósito es comprar un puesto en un tianguis para no andar de un lado a otro y estar bien establecido. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Minerva, Rosalba, Rosario y Norma ellas invertirán sus créditos en una tienda de abarrotes, en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is a hardworking man. He is responsible with his payments. He says that he previously was in a group but unfortunately one of the members died and the group broke up. He decided to join his neighbor’s group as he knew her as a hardworking and reliable woman. 

He states that he works selling secondhand clothing and shoes. He says that it all began because when he was working in the United States he sent clothing to his wife for her to sell and as he saw it was a very good business he decided to return to be at his family’s side and they could make the business more productive together. Leopoldo says, “while my wife positions herself at the front door of the house I go to sell in the street markets in the area. Sometimes I take the car to sell at the farmhouses and if sales go very well it is because I bring quality clothing at a low price.”

He gets his clothing in a village called Hidalgo, Michoacán, where they sale  bales (wholesale) of clothing of different sizes, colors, and for every taste. He says that he is asking for a loan because he wants to replenish his merchandise because now another season is coming and he wants to have warm weather clothing. His goal is to buy a stand at a marketplace so he doesn’t have to walk from one side to the other, being established. 

The other members of the group are called Minerva, Rosalba, Rosario and Norma. they will invest their loans in a grocery store and in the purchase of supplies to make Mexican treats.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos e iniciar la preparación del terreno para que la plantación pueda tener una mejor  desarrollo y producción, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y trabajos de asistencia de la plantación, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad y tener todo listo a tiempo para inicios de lluvia hacer la siembra y que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad de la cosecha, y tener a corto plazo una producción adecuada. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener  la utilizará en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Pedro, 52, is married and lives with his children and wife, who are his biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to start preparing his plot of land so his farm can make better progress and produce better.  He also will pay for labor for applying the products and tending to the farm.  This way he'll be assured of doing a good job.

What he plans to do is make the most of the good climate and soil conditions for this crop, as well as put into practice his several years of experience managing basic grains.  He also will be able to buy the best-quality products to have everything ready on time for the beginning of the rainy season to do the planting, to have a healthy crop that develops well and yields a suitable crop in the short term.

He'll use the income he hopes to receive from the harvest for his family's well-being and studies, and to fulfill some family goals and continue investing more in the crops.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: La Ilusion Group

texts.es: El Grupo “La Ilusión” es un grupo integrado por solo mujeres todas se conocen muy bien porque viven en la misma comunidad donde la gente se caracteriza por tener sus negocios ya sean grandes o pequeños. Las integrantes del grupo platican que el nombre lo eligieron ellas mismas porque cuando les ofrecieron el crédito para ellas era una nueva ilusión para iniciar con sus negocios o actividades productivas y situación que si les ha funcionado muy bien porque hasta ahora todas tienen sus actividades productivas Doña Juana quien es una integrante del grupo platica que tiene 59 años de edad esta casada con el señor Fidel quien trabaja de constructor juntos formaron una familia con hijos pero ya todos son independientes, la señora Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a cría y engorda de cerdos para su venta esta vez está solicitando a la institución crédito para comprar alimento y maíz molido para sus animales porque ya tiene 10 cerdos y se le dificultara para alimentarlos todos juntos Doña Juanita cuenta que inicio su negocio porque el trabajo de Don Fidel solo era por temporadas y en temporadas largas no tenia trabajo y de alguna manera tenia que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y algunos gastos para la educación de sus hijos porque sus niños estaban pequeños y eran demasiados los gastos. Doña Juanita menciona que la única dificultad que presenta es la falta de un buen corral para mantener en buen estado sus cerdos porque debido al espacio no puede hacer crecer más ganado, sin embargo ella y Don Fidel su esposo tiene la meta de tener su granja mas grande para poder vender más  animales,  Doña Juanita y las integrantes están muy contentas  y agradecidas con la institución porque para ellas será de gran ayuda para seguir con sus actividades productivas como Doña Agustina invertirá en alimento para sus becerros, Leocadia, Sara, Dolores invertirán en borregos, Doña Socorro en la venta de ropa, Doña Rosa, Elena invertirán en Cerdos, finalmente Doña Carmen invertirá en Dulces para su venta.
texts.en:
The group La Illusion is a group made up of women only who all know each other very well because they live in the same community where people are known by their businesses, large or small. The members of the group say that they chose their name because for them, when they were offered credit, it was a new dream to begin their businesses or productive activities and positions and its working very well because now they have productive activities.

Juana who is a member of the group says that she is 59 years old and married to Fidel who works as a builder and they have a family with grown independent children. Juanita, as she says warmly, raises and fattens pigs for sale and this time she is asking for a loan from the institution to buy feed and hominy for her animals because she has 10 pigs and it is difficult to feed each and every one. Juanita says that she began her business because Fidel’s work was only seasonal and during the long seasons without work she needed some way to help her husband with household expenses and school fees for the children who were small, and there were too many expenses. Juanita says that the only difficulty is not having a good pigpen to keep her pigs in good condition, and because of the space she can’t raise more livestock, but she and her husband Fidel have the goal of having a bigger homestead in order to have more animals.

Juanita and the members are very happy and grateful to the institution because for them it will be a big help to continue their productive activities. Agustina will invest in feed for her calves, Leocadia, Sara, and Dolores will invest in lambs, Socorro in clothing sales, Rosa and Elena will invest in pigs, and finally Carmen will invest in sweets for sale.

loans.use: to buy feed and corn for 10 pigs

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Jaime tiene 29 años de edad es originario de una población llena en riqueza histórica llamada Heroica Zitacuaro ya que tres veces fue quemada y volvió a poblarse después de quemada. La gente que habita es cordial y amable, muy cerca de esa población se encuentra uno de los santuarios más importantes del país el de la Mariposa Monarca. Jaime pertenece al grupo llamado Abejitas Trabajadoras, ellos platican que la abeja es uno de los animales más trabajadores y ellos se consideran así. Él desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, caballero y niños, dice que se empezó a interesar por el negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y para ayudarle a sus papas con los gastos de la casa decidió vender ropa en pagos a sus amigos y conocidos, dice que va la población de Moroleon ya que allá se encuentran las fabricas de ropa y es mas económica y así el puede ganar algo, el está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de ropa de la nueva temporada primavera- verano dice que comprara pantalones de mezclilla, playeras, camisetas, blusas de moda es por eso que está pidiendo su crédito. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa y Nubia ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de material para hacer costuras artesanales, para la compra de material para elaboración de muebles, para la compra de insumos para hacer antojitos mexicanos, en insumos para la compra de pan y para taller de manualidades.
texts.en:
Jaime, 29, is from a town rich in history called Heroica Zitacuaro [Heroic Zitacuaro], because it burned three times and was repopulated after burning.  The residents are cordial and friendly.  One of the most important sanctuaries in the country is there, the monarch butterfly sanctuary.

Jaime belongs to the Abejitas Trabajadoras group.  They say the bee is one of the hardest-working animals and they consider themselves to be the same.

For a year he has made a living selling clothing for women, men, and children.  He says he became interested in the business because he didn't have a stable job.  He decided to sell clothing to his friends and acquaintances on credit to help his parents with the household expenses.  He says he goes to the community of Moroleón because there are clothing factories there and it's more economical, so he can earn some profits.

He's requesting a loan to buy clothing for the new spring and summer seasons.  He says he's requesting his loan to buy jeans, beach shoes, t-shirts, and fashionable blouses.

The other members of the group are Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, and Nubia.  They will use their loans to buy materials for handmade clothing, to buy materials to make furniture, to buy supplies to make Mexican snacks, and to buy materials for bread and for a craft workshop.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing

loans.name: Otabek

texts.ru:
Отабек мужчина в возрасте 38 лет, женат имеет двоих детей.  Его жена домохозяйка занимается воспитанием детей.  Его вид деятельности заключается в том,что он занимается торговлей запчастей от автомобиля.  Этим бизнесом Отабек занимается уже два года. От этого бизнеса у него очень хороший доход. У него имеется автозапчасти всех видов марок авто. Клиентов очень много, сам тоже разбирается в  ремонте автомобилей, и знает как устранить неисправность.  Отабек живет отдельно от родителей и ждать помощи не от кого, поэтому старается развивать свой бизнес. 
  На запрашиваемый кредит Отабек планирует закупить шины для авто. Сейчас очень большой спрос на авто шин поэтому он хочет срочно купить. Отабек заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Otabek is 38 years old, married, and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker and stay-at-home mom. He earns a living by selling spare parts for cars. He has been in this line of business for 2 years now, and makes a good income from it. He carries spare parts for all makes of automobile. He has many clients, and he also knows how to fix cars and is able to make repairs. Otabek lives independently from his parents and does not expect any help from anyone, which is why he is trying to develop his business.
   Otabek plans to use the loan he is seeking to stock up on car tires. There is currently big demand for tires, so he wants to buy some immediately. He thanks Kiva in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy car tires

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru:
Махбуба замужняя женщина и  мать четверых детей.  Ее вид деятельности заключается в том,что она занимается скотоводством.  Этим бизнесом Махбуба  занимается с раннего детства так как ее родители тоже в  свое время откармливали скот. У нее несколько голов скота, также у нее имеется две дойные коровы. Каждое утро она продает соседям и знакомым молоко и молочные продукты(кефир, творог кисло-молочные шарики)которые сама производит.
 Сын Махбубы помогает ей по откорму скота. Так как они живут в сельской местности их скот пасется на пастбище и ее сын смотрит за ними и вечером привозит их домой. 
 Сейчас зима и травы практически нет поэтому Махбуба обратилась в организацию Кива для приобретения корма для скота. Она до весны хочет закупить корм и откормить своих скотов, и весной планирует продать по выгодной цене.
На полученный кредит Махбуба хочет купить корм для скота и заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba is married and has 4 children. She earns her living by raising cattle. She has been involved in this business since her early childhood, as her parents' livelihood was fattening cattle. Mahbuba has several head of cattle, and she also has 2 dairy cows. Every morning she sells her neighbours and her acquaintances milk and dairy products such as kefir and cottage cheese that she makes herself. Her son helps her to raise the cattle. Because they live in a rural area, the cows graze in a pasture where her son watches them and leads them home in the evening. Now it is winter and there is practically no grass for the cows to graze on, so Mahbuba has approached Kiva for a loan to buy feed for her livestock. She wants to buy the feed before spring, fatten the cows, and sell them at a good price come spring. She plans to use the loan to buy feed, and she thanks Kiva in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: Gulbarchyn

texts.ru: Гулбарчын 38 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. Все дети Гулбарчын школьники, старший сын заканчивает школу. Дети в свободное от работы время помогают матери.  Гулбарчын в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1998 года занимается разведением скота, начав этот бизнес с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день у Гульбарчын имеется 2 коровы, 2 нетели, 30 овец и 4 кобылы, животноводство ежемесячно приносит около 5,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулбарчын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  3 голов коров для увеличения доходов от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Гулбарчын планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства и в образование детей.
texts.en:
Gulbarchyn is 38 years old, married and raising 4 children. All Gulbarchyn's children are schoolchildren, the eldest son is finishing school. In their free time the children help their mother. 

In search of a main source of income for her family, Gulbarchyn has worked with livestock breeding since 1998, after having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Currently Gulbarchyn has two cows, two heifers, 30 sheep and four mares, and the livestock breeding brings in around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulbarchyn turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of three cows in order to increase the income from selling milk. Gulbarchyn plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and in the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза жительница города Хамадони. Ей 23 года. Она замужем. У нее двое маленьких детей. Шахноза имеет среднее образование. Она занимается животноводством у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Шахноза занимается два года. Она берет кредит для закупа коровы, быка и телят.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a resident of the city of Hamadoni. She is 23 years old and married. She has two small children. 

Shahnoza has secondary education. She works with livestock breeding at her home. Shahnoza has been engaged in this type of activity for two years. 

She takes a loan for the purchase of a cow, a  bull and calves.

loans.use: to purchase a cow, a bull and calves

loans.name: Bahridin

texts.ru: Бахридин трудолюбивый и честный человек. Ему 58 лет. Несколько лет он работал вместе с сыновьями за пределами страны. Теперь он не хочет больше ехать в заграницу. Он хочет здесь в своем городе начать свой бизнес. Бахридин собирается заниматься торговлей продуктами питания на рынке Гиссар. Чтобы осуществить свою цель он обратился за кредитом. Бахридин берет кредит для приобретения ассортимента продуктов питания (чай, сахар, макароны, конфеты, печенье и т.д.). Бахридин хочет преуспеть в бизнесе и с его прибыли купить дом своему сыну.
texts.en:
Bahridin is a hardworking and honest man. He is 58 years old. He worked together with his sons outside the country for some years. Currently he would not like to travel abroad anymore. He would like to start his business here, in his city. 

Bahridin decided to work with selling food products at the market in Gissar. In order to realize his goal he turned to us for a loan. Bahridin takes a loan for the purchase of an assortment of food products (tea, sugar, macaroni, sweets, biscuits and so on). Bahridin would like to succeed in business and with his income purchase a house to his son.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 29 years old. She lives in Martvili District with her husband, son, and mother-in-law. Darejan requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where nut trees grow. They sell the nuts locally at a good price. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Darejan requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frame of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, Darejan will purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, she will be able to produce cheese products and sell them locally. This will increase the family's income. The new business initiative, financed with this Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Zulpiya

texts.ru: Зулпия жительница района Шахритус. Ей 64 года. Она замужем и мать пятерых детей. Ее муж занимается растениеводством и торговлей. Зулпию интересует животноводство и она хотела бы попробовать себя в этой области. Она хочет заниматься куплей и продажей телят и коров. С этой целью она берет кредит. За счет прибыли Зулпия планирует сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Zulpiya is a resident of the Shahrituz region. She is 64 years old. She is married, and the mother of five children. Her husband works with crop production and trade. 

Zulpiya is interested in livestock breeding and she would like working in this area. She would like to work with buying and reselling of calves and cows. With this aim she takes a loan. Zulpiya plans to repair her house, using this income.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Алишер занимается ремонтом автомашин. Он арендует помещение, где предоставляет услугу, вулканизация. В этой области Алишер два года. Он берет кредит для приобретения аппарата для балансировки и покупки инструментов.
texts.en: Alisher lives in the Hamadoni Region. He is 41 years old. He is married, with three children. Alisher is a car mechanic. He rents a shop where he provides tire vulcanization services. He has been working in this business for two years. He is taking out a loan to buy a wheel balancer and tools.

loans.use: to buy a wheel balancer and car repair tools.

loans.name: Kanayim

texts.ru: Канаиым 47 лет. Образование у Канаиым среднее. В течении уже многих лет  Канаиым является руководителем программы по совершенствованию системы здравоохранения в селе . Единственный сын живет с Канаыим он и является основным помощником мамы.  Младшая дочка учится в лицеи и проживает с ними, в свободное от школы время дочь помогает маме. Старшие две дочери обустроены и имеют свои собственные семьи. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина. Еще до развала СССР 30 лет назад семья начала занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас семья выращивает скот и занимается полеводством. Совокупный годовой доход семьи составляет около 240,000 KGS Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канаиым обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. На прибыль от кредита планирует дать образование внукам.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 47 years old and has a secondary education.  For many years already, she has been the director of her village's public health care program.  Her only son lives with her and happens to be her main helper.  She also has three daughters: the youngest lives with her.  She is a secondary school student who helps her mother during her spare time.  Kanayim's two older daughters are now independent and have their own families.

By nature, Kanayim is a pleasant and kindhearted woman.  Her family became involved in farming 30 years ago, even before the collapse of the Soviet Union.  The family now raises livestock and cultivates field crops.  The family's total yearly income comes close to 240,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Kanayim has turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young bulls and sheep.  She plans to use the profits from this loan to pay for her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase bulls and sheep.

loans.name: Pardaboy

texts.ru: Пардабою 38 лет. Он женат. У него четыре детей. Супруга Пардабоя умеет вышивать национальные женские одежды. Однако у нее нет швейной машины. Пардабой хотел бы помочь жене в открытии бизнеса, так как вышивание прибыльное дело в нашей стране. Для этого он обратился за кредитом. На полученный кредит Пардабой собирается приобрести швейную машину. За счет прибыли с деятельности жены Пардабой планирует сделать долгожданный ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Pardaboy is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. Pardaboy's wife knows how to embroider traditional women's clothing. However, she  has no sewing machine. Pardaboy would like to help his wife launch a business since embroidery is a profitable occupation in [Tajikistan]. This is why he has applied for a loan. He plans to use a loan to buy a sewing machine. Pardaboy plans to use the revenues from his wife's business in order to make some long awaited home renovations.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita, 51 years of age, is married. They were blessed with seven children. 

Carmencita is a vegetable vendor in the village of San Luis. When she sells, she earns a net income of PHP 5,000 every month. 

Carmencita requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase vegetables to sell. Her income usually goes to the family’s daily expenditures. She's hoping that her requested loan amount will be granted so that she will be able to gain more income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell in their village.

loans.name: Abumuslim

texts.ru:
Абумуслим проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 30 лет. Он холост. Абумуслим жизнерадостный и отзывчивый молодой человек. Он любит трудится и зарабатывать своим трудом. 
Вот уже два года как Абумуслим занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, которую обрабатывает и сеет зернобобовые культуры, овощи. Абумуслим берет кредит для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en:
Abumuslim lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 30 years old and single.  He is a cheerful and kindhearted young man who loves to work and to earn a living through his hard work.

He has been involved in agriculture for two years already.  He cultivates a parcel of land which he rents and on which he grows legumes and vegetables.  He is taking a loan to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. Her previous loan was a big help, not just in her business, but also in her daily expenses. She was able to buy all the needed products for her grocery store, and that helped a lot in generating more income. Her business has been running for fifteen years now, and it keeps on growing. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses.

Gloria would like to apply for another loan, this time for 40,000 PHP, to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a good and peaceful life. She faithfully meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a business-oriented woman. She is happily married with two children. Delia manages a general store and carinderia in her neighborhood.

Delia has run her carinderia for ten years and her general store for one. She is thankful because the types of food she sells are very popular. She and her spouse work together to invest in a motorcycle transport business. Their income goes toward household expenses, monthly payments for electric bills, and two single motor bikes.

Delia hopes to re-stock her general store and buy raw meat and vegetables for her carinderia business. She is seeking additional capital of 5,000 PHP. Using this loan, she wants to further increase her sales, which will enable her to provide for her family's daily necessities and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies for her grocery and food sales business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, 36, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable farm in her village for almost 13 years, where she plants a variety of vegetables such as string beans, eggplants, tomatoes, and squash. When harvest season comes, she will deliver her vegetables to the public market. Janeth is earns a net income of 5,000 PHP every month. Her monthly net income usually goes to her children's allowances. 

Janeth is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers. She's hoping the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hotamqul

texts.ru:
Хотамкул мужчина в возрасте  42 лет, он женат и имеет   троих  детей.  Он  занимается животноводством с юности так как в свое время не смог получить образования. У него с детства в семье были финансовые проблемы, поэтому он вынужден заниматься только животноводством. Его дети уже подросли и им необходимо обзаводиться своими семьями и Хотамкул старается копить денежные средства чтобы купить приданное. 
 Сейчас у него несколько голов скота и до весны он хочет купить еще несколько, так как весной скот подорожает и он сможет продать по дороже и соответственно таким образом  увеличит свой капитал. Хотамкул очень надеется на финансовую поддержку от организации Кива, так как это единственное решение его планов. Он очень рад,что благодаря таким организациям как Кива люди имеющие финансовые проблемы могут решить их и осуществить свои планы.
На полученный кредит Хотамкул планирует купить скот и корм для скота.
texts.en:
Hotamqul is 42 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He did not have the opportunity to get an education and has been involved in animal husbandry since his youth.  When he was growing up, his family had financial difficulties, which is why he has only been raising livestock.  Now that his children have grown, they also need to create their own families, and Hotamqul is trying hard to gather enough money for their dowries. 

Hotamqul currently owns a few head of livestock, but he would like to buy a few more before the spring.  Livestock prices will go up in the spring and if he does not purchase livestock before then, he will not be able to resell at a profit and therefore increase his capital.

Hotamqul is hoping to receive financial support from Kiva, as this is the only way to see his project materialize.  He is very grateful that, thanks to an organization like Kiva, people who have financial difficulties are able to solve them and achieve their goals.

He plans to use his loan to buy some livestock and animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more coconuts, and her production and income improved. 

Nenita has been in the coconut sales business for 20 years now, and it helps a lot with her family expenses. She and her husband, who is a community counselor, work hard to provide income for their family. 

Nenita would like to apply for another 24,000 PHP loan to buy more coconuts for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. She hopes her business will continue to grow. She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hog farmer living at Solana with her spouse and three children. They make their living farming and raising hogs for sale. They manage their businesses to provide the best education for their children. Mercedita usually gains 3,000 PHP for each hog she sells. Her income helps her to maintain her hogs and provide a daily allowance for her children. 

Mercedita is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to invest in her business. She will buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for hog farming. This will help her grow healthier hogs and sell them at a higher profit.

Mercedita would like to keep improving her family's businesses to sustain the education needs of her children so that they can earn degrees and improve their employment options.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Minakhan

texts.ru: Минахан очень благодарна всем инвесторам фонда КИВА. Предыдущий кредит помог очень хорошо. В этот раз она планирует приобрести овец для перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Минахон обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец.
texts.en: Minakhan is very grateful to all the Kiva lenders. The previous loan was a very good help. This time, she plans to buy sheep for resale. With the goal of further developing her business, Minakhan appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor is 52 years old and married with three children. Two of his children are already working, while his youngest child is still a college student.

Villamor is engaged in hog raising and farming. He currently cultivates three hectares of corn. He has been running his hog business for 20 years and farming for 25. He is thankful because, through his determination and sacrifices, he is able to help his two children finish their studies and sustain their daily needs.

Profits from his hog raising business are used to purchase expensive supplies for his corn farming business. Villamor plans to buy two additional piglets to raise, but his capital is insufficient. Villamor is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP. He knows that this loan will really help him meet his goals in his life and in his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and supplies for his hog raising business.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.ru: Абдулхаким житель района Хамадони. Ему 53 года. Он разведен. У него пятеро детей. Абдулхаким занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более семи лет. Абдулхаким берет кредит для посева картошки, моркови, кукурузы и лука. Он хочет посеять и получить богатый урожай овощей для продажи.
texts.en:
Abdulhakim is a resident of the Hamadoni region. He is 53 years old. He is divorced. He has five children. 

Abdulhakim is engaged in planting crops. He has been involved in this type of activity for seven years. Abdulhakim is taking a loan to plant potatoes, carrots, corn, and onions. He wants to plant and get a bumper crop of vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to plant potatoes, carrots, corn, and onions

loans.name: Saidkhon

texts.ru:
Саидхон пожилой мужчина  в возрасте 60 лет.   Он женат у него трое детей.   Сам  Саидхон занимается торговлей разных мешков(бумажные мешки, матерчатые мешки)  для овощей и фруктов.  Ему в этом помогает его младший сын.  А старший сын тоже занимается торговлей но он продает авто-запчасти.  У них очень дружная семья, они во всем поддерживают друг друга.  Саидхон очень долгое время мечтал купить автомобиль, и сейчас они накопили немного денег но все равно не хватает на авто. Поэтому Саидхон обратился в организацию Арванд за финансовой поддержкой,чтобы получить нужную сумму и добавив свои накопленные деньги планирует купить автомашину. 
Саидхон заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Saidkhon is an older man at the age of 60 years. He is married and has three children. Saidkhon is engaged in trade of different bags (paper bags, cloth bags) for vegetables and fruits. He is helped in this by his younger son. And his older son is also engaged in trade, but he sells auto parts. They have a very close-knit family, and they all support each other. 

Saidkhon has for a very long time dreamed of buying a car, and now they have accumulated a little money but still not enough for a car. Therefore, Saidkhon appealed to Arvand for financial support, in order to get the needed amount and, adding his accumulated money, plans to purchase a car. 
 
Saidkhon sends his thanks in advance to Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Jagna, Bohol. Evelyn runs a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and items to people in her neighborhood. She has been in this business for more than 15 years now. 

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like rice, candies, soda, noodles, and canned goods, as well as soap and toiletries. This will help her attract more customers and cater to their needs, thus increasing her sales and profit.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children. Evelyn also wants to repay her loan on time so that she can take another one for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries and other items for sale at her general store.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
This is Eric. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy new spare parts for his three-wheeled motorcycle. 

Eric has been in the motorcycle transport business for twelve years now. This business provides the income for his family, and it has helped them a lot financially. 

Eric would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, maintain his motorcycle, and buy some equipment for his repair shop. His profits will help him to sustain his family's daily needs and pay the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Eric dreams of giving his children a good quality education and hopes for good health for his family. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Shul'amoh

texts.ru:
Шулъамох проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Муж Шулъамох находится на заработках за рубежом. Шулъамох имеет среднее образование.
Шулъамох на протяжении семи лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. У нее при доме имеется участок земли, где она выращивает овощи. Шулъамох берет кредит для закупа семян картошки, кукурузы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Shul'amoh lives in the Qumsangir region. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children. Shul'amoh's husband is working abroad. Shul'amoh has a high school education.

For seven years, Shul'amoh has been planting crops. She has a plot of land near her home where she grows vegetables. 

Shul'amoh is taking a loan for the purcahse of seed potatoes, maize, and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to plant vegetables and legumes

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима жительница района Пяндж. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж и двое сыновей Фотимы уехали на заработки в Россию. Фотима хочет начать свой бизнес. Ее интересует животноводческая деятельность. Так как у Фотимы нет достаточных денежных средств, она обратилась за кредитом. Она берет кредит на сумму 2000 долларов и заняться купле продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Фотима надеется на успешность своего бизнеса, и за счет прибыли женить сына.
texts.en:
Fotima is a resident of the Payandj region. She is 47 years old. She is married, and has three children. Her husband and two sons have gone to work in Russia. Fotima wants to start her own business. She is interested in livestock activities. 

Since Fotima does not have sufficient money, she applied for a loan. She is taking a loan of $2,000 and is getting involved in the buying and selling of livestock. Fotima hopes for the success of her business, and will use the profits for her son's marriage.

loans.use: to buy short-horned livestock

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her business, which results in a bigger income. They also have a junk shop, which is managed by her husband. They are both working hard to provide income for their business.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna dreams that her business will expand even more and hopes to have a vacation. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 55 years old and has a child. She is raising hogs to acquire an income. She had been in her business for over 10 years now. She usually gains PHP 2,000 for each hog sold. Now, she hopes to keep making her sales profitable and she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to invest in her business. She will buy feed and vaccines for her hogs. This will help maintain good nutrition for the hogs and she can sell them at a profit upon maturity. 

Though she only generates a minimal income from her business, Erlinda continuously works toward better sales to achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
This is Cyril. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her everyday expenses. She has been in this business for 10 years now and her business is continuously growing. She has a stall in the market, which is a good spot for getting more customers.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Cyril hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a good and happy family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week.  There, she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alinia

texts.en: Alinia, 44 years old, is widowed and has four children. She has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost four years. She has a net income of PHP 3,000 every month. She wants to taker a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase canned goods, breads, curls, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand her retail store to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, breads, curls, noodles, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 28 years old. She owns a boutique and has been in that business for the past six years. She wants the loan to buy more chewing gums and kitchen utensils to increase her inventory in order for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for sale such as chewing gums, kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Mame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008 il regroupe des femmes d'un même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.Le responsable madame Mame est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans et mère de cinq enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles. 
Elle est la femme qui lève la main sur la photo, elle est habillé en wax vert fleurette.
Son nouveau crédit de 250000 francs cfa lui permettra de payer de la marchandises composée de piment poivre sel bouillon cube du lait du café et du sucre qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau du village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d'aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiers telles que payer du riz et de l'huile.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 1, 2008, consists of women who come from the same village and who are united by good social and professional relationships.

Mame is the group's representative: she is 39 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls).  In the photo, she is the woman raising her hand and wearing a flowery green wax-print dress.

With her new loan of 250,000 CFA francs, she will buy the following products: pimento, pepper, salt, "bouillon cubes", milk, coffee and sugar.  She will resell her goods for retail, in her village.

The profits from this loan will allow her to help her husband cover some of the family daily needs, such as the purchase of rice and oil.

loans.use: to buy condiments, milk and coffee for her small retail business.

loans.name: Ami's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis longtemps et il regroupe deux femmes de la même localité unies par de bonnes relations sociales. Madame Amy est l'emprunteur en vedette, elle est  debout à gauche de la photo recouvert d'un écharpe blanc. 
Âgée de 57 ans, elle est mère de 10 enfants dont 5 garçons. Elle s'active dans l'embauche bovine depuis un peu longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs cfa lui permettra des moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires de ses enfants et d'aider son mari dans l'achat de fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
This group has been in existence for a long time.  It consists of two women who are from the same locality and are united by good social relationships.  Ami, the featured borrower, is the woman on the left in the photo, wearing a white scarf.  She is 57 years old and the mother of ten children, five of whom are boys.  For a while now, she has been actively involved in fattening livestock, and she has a good experience in this field.

With her new loan of 300,000 CFA francs, she will buy some sheep and raise them for future resale.

Thanks to the profits from her business, she will be able to cover her children's nutritional needs and will also help her husband with the purchase of school supplies.

loans.use: to buy two sheep for fattening up.

loans.name: Merilen

texts.en:
Merilen is a 41-year-old married woman from Jagna, Bohol, Philippines. She is a mother of a 16-year-old son. Merilen operates a convenience store, selling various goods to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than five years now.

Merilen is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa owns and runs a home-based variety store. She is 44 years of age and married with two children. Elsa's dream is to have a stable source of income and be able to sell school supplies within her locality. Elsa is a business-oriented woman; she currently manages a variety store and a fish pond, and does farming and hog raising.

Elsa aims to make all her businesses profitable so she could let her two children finish their studies, sustain their basic needs, increase the hectares of rice field she cultivates and increase the number of hogs she raises. To make all these things possible, Elsa is requesting additional capital in the amount of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will be using this capital in buying a variety of groceries such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, ingredients and various kinds of vegetables. She knows that through the completeness of groceries she offers, she can further increase her sales and profits, which will lead her to obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy a variety groceries such as instant noodles, soft drinks, canned goods, cooking oil, ingredients and various kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 61 years old, married with five children, and living in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Isabel sells dried fish for a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase more dried fish to sell.
Isabel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin. His previous loan was a big help in his business. He was able to buy the necessary ingredients for his food stall. The loan also helped in meeting the everyday expenses that he and his wife work hard to meet. He has been in this business for ten years. He also does landscaping projects.

He would like to apply for another loan of 14,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in his business. The profits from the business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and his children's educational expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edwin dreams that his youngest child will finish his studies and hopes that his business will grow even more. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients such as rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with four children. Jocelyn is 50 years old and lives in P.3 , Labo Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jocelyn sells dried fish to earn a living. Each week, she earns 700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 7000 PHP to purchase more dried fish for her retail business.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 34 years old and lives in Brgy. Tabid, Ozamiz city, Philippines. She is married with two school-aged children and one infant.

Robelyn will use the loan amount to repair their house. She is also engaged in food production and sales fully supported by her husband. She's been doing this for almost two years.

Robelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. She hopes to operate a small business in the city after two years.

loans.use: To purchase some materials needed  for house repair.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 45 years old and is married to Romeo, a father who works as a farmer. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. To generate income, Rowena has been engaged in her general store for nine years and usually earns about 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day. At this time, Rowena is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, delicacies, and condiments to sell. Rowena hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted bread, delicacies, and condiments to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed materials for her tailoring business, and she was able to make more dresses. She has been in this business for three years now, and it continues to grow. She is working hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan for her to buy fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Anita dreams to have a good and prosperous life and hopes that her business will grow even more. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie didn't finish her studies due to lack of finances. She is now 28 years of age and happily married with four children. All her four children go to school. Lanie doesn't want her children to experience what she went through during her young age. So, at her best, she endures everything in order to give her family a better way of living.
